translated: that he resides in the relative truth.

original: yang na bdag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na bdag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Alternatively, “I” means

original: dga' ba'i rgyus so //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyus so //
translated: the cause of joy.

original: thos pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thos pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “Heard” means

original: mchog dga'o // dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog dga'o // dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: supreme joy. “At one time” means

original: de nas rnam par dga' ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas rnam par dga' ba bstan to //
translated: then, the joy of separation is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Bhagavān” means

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of innate joy.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs te /
translated: Residing in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathāgatas means

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that

original: mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rgyu rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pas 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rgyu rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: he is the cause of benefiting migrating beings by possessing the six superknowledges.

original: yang na bdag gis zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag gis zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Alternatively, “I” means the karma consort.

original: thos pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: “Heard” means the dharma consort.

original: dus gcig ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dus gcig ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: One time is the samaya mudra.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Bhagavān is

original: phyag rgya chen po ste phyag rgya bzhi'i bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ste phyag rgya bzhi'i bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga'o //
translated: the great mudra. The nature of the four mudras is the bhaga of the vajra queen of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: la zhes pa ni de la bzhugs nas 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la zhes pa ni de la bzhugs nas 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The syllable la means that, abiding in that, he accomplishes the welfare of migrating beings.

original: mdor na yang brtags pa de thams cad rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: mdor na yang brtags pa de thams cad rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: In brief, all of those imputations are the nature of the two, permanent and impermanent, virtuous and nonvirtuous, and so on.

original: de yang yi ge ae dang wam gyis rgyas btab pa las gnyis ga tha mi dad pas de nyid ae wam yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de yang yi ge ae dang wam gyis rgyas btab pa las gnyis ga tha mi dad pas de nyid ae wam yin par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, since neither of those two is different from the seal of the syllables e and vam, it is taught that they are e and vam.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sdom pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sdom pa ni //
translated: The vow of all buddhas

original: ae wam rnam par rab tu gnas //
analyzed: ae wam rnam par rab tu gnas //
translated: Resides in e and vam.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / ae yi cha byad bzang po gang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ae yi cha byad bzang po gang //
translated: Whatever is the good form of e

original: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: Is adorned in the middle with vam.

original: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gnas //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi ni gnas //
translated: The abode of all bliss.🔽The Buddha is the jewel casket.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa dang / gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen za ma tog / ces pa dang / gzhan las kyang /
translated: And also in another text:

original: ae wam yi ge shes pa @8a * //
analyzed: ae wam yi ge shes pa @8a * //
translated: One who knows the syllable evam

original: gang // ma lus mtha' dag shes pa yin //
analyzed: gang // ma lus mtha' dag shes pa yin //
translated: knows everything without exception.🔽He is the casket of Dharma,

original: de ni chos kyi za ma tog / gnyug ma'i mnga' bdag 'di la gnas //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi za ma tog / gnyug ma'i mnga' bdag 'di la gnas //
translated: the lord of the innate abides in this.

original: de'i phyir ae wam nyid khams gsum yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ae wam nyid khams gsum yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, evam itself is the three realms, not anything else.

original: 'di ni yi ge gnyis kyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yi ge gnyis kyi bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the two syllables.

original: de ltar na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i tshig 'di yin no zhes pa /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi'i tshig 'di yin no zhes pa /
translated: Thus, this is the nidana verse of all tantras.

original: 'di'i don gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: This is the determination of its meaning.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' don la rton par bya ba'i tshig de ji lta ba de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' don la rton par bya ba'i tshig de ji lta ba de ltar ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should rely on the meaning, not on the words.

original: yang na ae ni shes rab po /
analyzed: yang na ae ni shes rab po /
translated: Or else, e is wisdom,

original: wam ni thabs so //
analyzed: wam ni thabs so //
translated: vam is method.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni sku rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bdag nyid ni sku rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of these two is the meaning of “vajra body.”

original: bdag gis thos pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes pa ni /
translated: “I have heard” means

original: tshig khong du chud pa ste gsung rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshig khong du chud pa ste gsung rdo rje zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “vajra speech” is that the words are comprehended.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At one time means

original: gcig ni zla med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni zla med pa'o //
translated: one is without a second.

original: 'di ltar lha nyid yang dag par bsdoms nas 'dus pa'i dus te thugs rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha nyid yang dag par bsdoms nas 'dus pa'i dus te thugs rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the time of the assembly of the deities is gathered. The meaning of “vajra mind” is that

original: 'di nyid chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid chos kyi sku ste /
translated: this is the dharmakāya,

original: sku 'di gnyis kyi rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: sku 'di gnyis kyi rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: because it is the cause of these two kāyas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la zhes pa ni /🔽thams cad kyang de yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la zhes pa ni / thams cad kyang de yin la /
translated: In the bhaga of the vajra queen of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: all are that, and they are also tathāgatas, thus they are all tathāgatas, which are the five aggregates, such as form, and so on.

original: de nyid sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: de nyid sku gsung thugs so //
translated: That is the body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum tha mi dad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum tha mi dad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the vajra, which is the gnosis of the non-differentiation of the three kāyas of the tathāgatas.

original: de nyid btsun mo ste /
analyzed: de nyid btsun mo ste /
translated: That is the queen,

original: rnal 'byor ma ni de'i cha //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni de'i cha //
translated: and the yoginī is her part.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: de nyid bha ga'i ye shes che //
analyzed: de nyid bha ga'i ye shes che //
translated: That is the great intuition of the bhaga.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of all the qualities of the Lord, etc.

original: la bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: la bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He dwells in the bhaga.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i bdag nyid des bzhugs so //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i bdag nyid des bzhugs so //
translated: He dwells in the bhaga by the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: gnyis su med pa'i sku can gyi rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ston pa po dang sdud pa po yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i sku can gyi rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ston pa po dang sdud pa po yin te /
translated: That very Vajra Holder, whose body is nondual, is the teacher and the compiler.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: 'chang ba po nga chos kyang nga //
analyzed: 'chang ba po nga chos kyang nga //
translated: The holder is I, and the doctrine is I.

original: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan par //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs ldan nyan par //
translated: The assembly of my own is the hearer.

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: Thus it is.

original: ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi po 'dis thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi po 'dis thams cad bsdus te /
translated: By these four syllables e vaṃ ma ya, everything is included.

original: de ltar thams cad bzhi bzhi'o zhes pa dang / bzhi po thams cad kun dag kyang //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bzhi bzhi'o zhes pa dang / bzhi po thams cad kun dag kyang //
translated: Thus everything is fourfold, and all the four are pure.

original: ae wam yi ger yang dag 'dus //
analyzed: ae wam yi ger yang dag 'dus //
translated: All are included in the syllable e vaṃ.

original: zhes pa'o // der zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // der zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There means

original: de ltar khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas dang dus dang / 'khor dang bstan par bya ba @8b rab tu gsal ba nyid bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyi tshe tshad kyi spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par du 'phags pa'i gnas dang dus dang / 'khor dang bstan par bya ba @8b rab tu gsal ba nyid bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyi tshe tshad kyi spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the Lord, by the expansion and contraction of his own life-span, has made clear the preeminent place, time, retinue, and doctrine.

original: gang 'di bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid de ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i bdag nyid de ston pa yin te /
translated: The word Lord refers to the perfect nature-body of the Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ston pa ni da ltar byung ba nyid kyis dus gsum can yin pa nyid dang / thams cad la khyab pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad sdom pa gcig pa nyid kyis na ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ston pa ni da ltar byung ba nyid kyis dus gsum can yin pa nyid dang / thams cad la khyab pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad sdom pa gcig pa nyid kyis na ston pa yin no //
translated: The Lord's teaching is the teaching of the three times, because it is present, and it is the teaching of all, because it pervades all and is the one summary of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang //
translated: And again:

original: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
translated: Even though the king of the gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
analyzed: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
translated: a bad seed will not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byung gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the Buddhas appear,

original: skal pa med la 'bras mi 'byung //
analyzed: skal pa med la 'bras mi 'byung //
translated: the unfortunate will not get the fruit.

original: zhes pa dang gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang gzhan las kyang /
translated: And in another scripture:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung bar gnas pa 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung bar gnas pa 'di ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whether or not the Tathagatas arise, this is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rje btsun gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po rje btsun gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba /
translated: The essence of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas, more secret than secret,

original: ae ma'o rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so //
analyzed: ae ma'o rdo rje snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so //
translated: is the great compassion vajra essence.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sems dpa' chen po dang / dam tshig sems dpa'i snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba nyon cig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sems dpa' chen po dang / dam tshig sems dpa'i snying po dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba nyon cig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Listen to the essence of Vajrasattva, the great being, and the commitment being, called Hevajra, who is delighted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The essence of the body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas

original: kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga bsags pa'i rang bzhin sku'o //
analyzed: kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga bsags pa'i rang bzhin sku'o //
translated: is the body, which is the nature of the accumulation of the five aggregates characterized by universal illumination, beginning with form.

original: de yang brda'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gnas pa brjod pa'i phyir gsung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang brda'i rgyu mtshan du rnam par gnas pa brjod pa'i phyir gsung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of speech because it is expressed as the reason for the symbolic.

original: de yang gsung rigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi thugs kyi sku yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang gsung rigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi thugs kyi sku yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, it is the body of mind because it is the nature of the speech of reasoning.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa nyid kyis sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa nyid kyis sku gsung thugs so //
translated: It is the body, speech, and mind because it is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad snying po ni ma lus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad snying po ni ma lus pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, the essence of all the Tathagatas is the gnosis of all the Tathagatas without exception.🔽Again, what is it like?

original: slar yang de ci lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang de ci lta bu zhig ce na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rje btsun zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rje btsun zhes pa ste /
translated: the venerable one,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the object of the Sravakas, etc., and because it is to be worshipped in the Mahayana.

original: gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba ni /🔽gsang ba sdom pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba ni / gsang ba sdom pa ste /
translated: It is more secret than secret.🔽The secret is the vow.

original: gsang ba ni 'khor ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni 'khor ba ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The secret is samsara, the conventional truth.

original: shin tu gsang ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba ni /
translated: It is more secret

original: de las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir na @9a * //
analyzed: de las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir na @9a * //
translated: because it is beyond that.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the ultimate truth.

original: gnyi gar brgal nas shin tu 'das pas na gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi gar brgal nas shin tu 'das pas na gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba'o //
translated: Since it transcends both, it is more secret than secret.🔽Excellent, excellent, O great bodhisattva Vajra Heart,

original: ae ma'o byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so zhes bya ba la /🔽ae ma'o ni /
analyzed: ae ma'o byang chub sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po snying rje chen po legs so legs so zhes bya ba la / ae ma'o ni /
translated: Excellent, excellent means

original: yul ma yin pa mthong ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa mthong ba'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: that it is marvelous because of the greatness of seeing the non-object.

original: de nyid zhus nas nyan par byed pa legs so legs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid zhus nas nyan par byed pa legs so legs so zhes pa ni /
translated: Having asked about that, listening is excellent.

original: brtse ba dang bcas pas rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: brtse ba dang bcas pas rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: This is rejoicing with affection.

original: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Vajra Heart means

original: mi phyed pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i sku'o //
translated: that it is the indivisible body.

original: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great compassion means

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: that it is the nature of conventional truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great bodhisattva means

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: that it is the nature of ultimate truth.🔽

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis na rdo rje snying po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis na rdo rje snying po yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the essence of both.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sems dpa' chen po dang / dam tshig sems dpa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sems dpa' chen po dang / dam tshig sems dpa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The essence of Vajrasattva, the great being, and the commitment being is

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pas na rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pas na rdo rje sems dpa' ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Vajrasattva, the essence of the three vajras, indivisible, is the dharmakāya.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The great being is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' ni sprul pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' ni sprul pa'i sku yin te /
translated: The commitment being is the nirmāṇakāya.

original: sku gsum gyi ye shes su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi ye shes su gyur pa'o //
translated: The essence of the three kāyas is the five gnoses.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Hevajra is

original: gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'i bdag nyid dang / ye shes lnga'i sku dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa las dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi'i bdag nyid dang / ye shes lnga'i sku dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa las dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: the indivisible, the nature of two, three, four, the body of the five gnoses, Vajradhara, and inseparable from Nairātmya, the essence of nine.

original: phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i he ru ka'i sku dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i he ru ka'i sku dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: The body of Heruka with sixteen arms and so forth is called Hevajra.

original: nyon cig ces pa ni /
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa ni /
translated: Listen!

original: nyan pa'i spyod yul du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i spyod yul du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Make it the sphere of your hearing.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i rjes thogs su /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'i rjes thogs su /
translated: Thus, after the Blessed One had spoken,

original: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gsol pa /
translated: Vajragarbha made a request:

original: gang phyir rdo rje sems dpa' lags //🔽ji ltar sems dpa' chen po lags //
analyzed: gang phyir rdo rje sems dpa' lags // ji ltar sems dpa' chen po lags //
translated: Why is he Vajrasattva?🔽How is he a great being?

original: gang gis dam tshig sems dpa' lags //
analyzed: gang gis dam tshig sems dpa' lags //
translated: By what is he a commitment being?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gsungs //
translated: May the Blessed One tell me.

original: zhes gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs su ;
analyzed: zhes gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs su ;
translated: After this request,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One spoke:

original: rdo rje mi phyed ces byar brjod /
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed ces byar brjod /
translated: Vajra is said to be indivisible,

original: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
analyzed: sems dpa' srid pa gsum gcig pa //
translated: and sattva is the oneness of the three existences.

original: shes rab rigs pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: shes rab rigs pa 'di yis ni //
translated: By this reasoning of wisdom,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes byar brjod //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes byar brjod // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he is called Vajrasattva.

original: shes rab ni gsal bar gyi ye shes nyid kyis rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab ni gsal bar gyi ye shes nyid kyis rdo rje nyid do //
translated: Wisdom is the vajra itself by virtue of being the clear light of gnosis.

original: rigs pa ni rigs @9b pas so //
analyzed: rigs pa ni rigs @9b pas so //
translated: Reasoning is by virtue of the lineage.

original: sems dpa' nyid ni /
analyzed: sems dpa' nyid ni /
translated: As for being a sattva,

original: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: he is Vajrasattva, the dharmakāya, because of being the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: ye shes chen po'i ros gang ba //
analyzed: ye shes chen po'i ros gang ba //
translated: He is filled with the taste of great intuition.

original: sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen por brjod par bya // zhes pa la /
translated: He is called the Great Being.

original: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “great intuition”

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes so //
translated: is the intuition of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: de'i ro ni sna tshogs su nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ro ni sna tshogs su nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “Taste” is the characteristic of experiencing variety.

original: de yis gang ba ni theg pa chen po'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyis thos pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de yis gang ba ni theg pa chen po'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyis thos pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyis nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: “Filled with it” means that it is experienced by the Great Vehicle Bodhisattvas and so on through the intuition of hearing and so on.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: “Great Being” is the Enjoyment Body.

original: sku 'di gnyi ga yang ma ning gi rtags so //
analyzed: sku 'di gnyi ga yang ma ning gi rtags so //
translated: Both of these Bodies are the neuter sign.

original: rtag tu dam tshig la 'jug phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu dam tshig la 'jug phyir //
translated: Because he is always engaged in the commitments,

original: dam tshig sems dpa' brjod par bya //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' brjod par bya //
translated: he is called the Commitment Being.

original: zhes bya ba la rtag tu ni bar ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rtag tu ni bar ma chad pa'o //
translated: “Always” means uninterruptedly.

original: dam tshig ni lha thams cad 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ni lha thams cad 'byung ba ste /
translated: “Commitment” is the origin of all the deities,

original: yang dag par sdom zhing bsdus pa'i lhar byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdom zhing bsdus pa'i lhar byas pa'o //
translated: the deity that is truly collected and gathered.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir dam tshig sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / yongs su grub pa yin pa'i phyir dam tshig sems dpa' ni /
translated: The pledge beings are so called because they are engaged in the nature of the awareness beings and because they are fully accomplished.🔽

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The pledge-being is the emanation body of the vajra-holder, because it is engaged by its nature and because it is the thoroughly established nature.

original: de ltar sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid du dgyes pa'i rdo rje rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid du dgyes pa'i rdo rje rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Hevajra should be understood to have the nature of the three bodies.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje brjod pa'i don nyid rnam par rtog pa gsum blo la bsdogs nas /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje brjod pa'i don nyid rnam par rtog pa gsum blo la bsdogs nas /
translated: Having set forth the three concepts in the mind with regard to the meaning of the words of the tantra of Hevajra,

original: rdo rje snying pos gsol ba /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gsol ba /
translated: Vajragarbha makes a request:

original: ming bsdus pa ni 'di lta bu /🔽gang gis kye yi rdo rje lags //
analyzed: ming bsdus pa ni 'di lta bu / gang gis kye yi rdo rje lags //
translated: The concise name is like this.🔽By what is it Hevajra?

original: he yi rnam pas ci zhig bshad /
analyzed: he yi rnam pas ci zhig bshad /
translated: By what is it explained by the form of he?

original: badzra yis kyang de bzhin ci //🔽zhes smos pas /
analyzed: badzra yis kyang de bzhin ci // zhes smos pas /
translated: And by vajra, too, what is it?

original: gang gis kye'i rdo rje lags //
analyzed: gang gis kye'i rdo rje lags //
translated: By what is it Hevajra?

original: zhes pa ni yi ge gsum po 'di ci ltar yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge gsum po 'di ci ltar yin zhes pa'o //
translated: This means, “What are these three syllables?”

original: ming bsdus pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: ming bsdus pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The concise name is like this.

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis ming brda des bsdus te yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul gyis ming brda des bsdus te yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: This means that by this method, the name is concisely included and perfectly summarized by that term.

original: he yis byed pa ci zhig bshad //
analyzed: he yis byed pa ci zhig bshad //
translated: By what is it explained by the form of he?

original: badzra yis kyang de bzhin ci //
analyzed: badzra yis kyang de bzhin ci //
translated: Vajra also is just like that.

original: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: he ni snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: he ni snying rje chen po ste /
translated: He is great compassion,

original: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya //
analyzed: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya //
translated: and vajra should be stated as insight.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nying mtshams sbyor ba rtsad nas bcod pa he'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nying mtshams sbyor ba rtsad nas bcod pa he'o //
translated: He is the cutting off of the root of the linking up of the latent impressions of the afflictions.

original: de la byed pa ni 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed pa ni byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la byed pa ni 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed pa ni byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The agent is the one who accomplishes the welfare of the world, and that is called the agent.

original: 'di mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is not tenable,

original: gang byed pa med pa'i byed pa 'di nyid snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: gang byed pa med pa'i byed pa 'di nyid snying rje chen po ste /
translated: this very agent without action is great compassion.

original: gang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: gang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: That which is the ultimate truth is the conventional truth.

original: yang na ha ni thabs so //
analyzed: yang na ha ni thabs so //
translated: Or else, ha is the method,

original: ae ni shes rab po /
analyzed: ae ni shes rab po /
translated: and ai is insight.

original: @10a * // gnyi ga 'byed pa'i gnas skabs de gnyis su med pa nyid de ni snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: @10a * // gnyi ga 'byed pa'i gnas skabs de gnyis su med pa nyid de ni snying rje chen po ste /
translated: The nonduality of those two, the state of their separation, is great compassion.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa 'di nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i rgyu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa 'di nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: This very manifest enlightenment of the knowledge of all modes is the cause of engaging in one's own and others' aims.

original: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: badzra'ang shes rab brjod par bya // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should speak of the vajra and wisdom.

original: badzra ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: badzra ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vajra means the vajra-holder.

original: shes rab ni bdag med pa'o //🔽brjod par bya ni /
analyzed: shes rab ni bdag med pa'o // brjod par bya ni /
translated: Wisdom means selflessness.

original: rtogs par bya ba ste dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ste dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i don to //
translated: One should speak of means one should understand, the meaning of Hevajra.🔽Here,

original: 'dir / thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
analyzed: 'dir / thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
translated: the tantra of the nature of method and wisdom,

original: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni nga yis bshad kyis nyon // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: that I will explain, so listen!

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje dri ba gsum gyi don bstan nas /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje dri ba gsum gyi don bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the meaning of the three questions of Hevajra,

original: de bye brag tu bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bye brag tu bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: he speaks the commentary on that:

original: 'di'i don gyi bdag nyid de ci yin /
analyzed: 'di'i don gyi bdag nyid de ci yin /
translated: What is the nature of its meaning?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
translated: The tantra of the nature of method and wisdom,

original: ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa ni shin tu spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: ces pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa ni shin tu spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: means the explanation of the indivisibility of method and wisdom is not an object of experience.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: cha med pa dang cha dang bcas pa dag gis don dam pa dang kun rdzob tha mi dad par bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa de dbye ba sbyar nas 'grub par mi nus te /
analyzed: cha med pa dang cha dang bcas pa dag gis don dam pa dang kun rdzob tha mi dad par bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa de dbye ba sbyar nas 'grub par mi nus te /
translated: The ultimate and the conventional are not different, because of the indivisibility and the division.

original: sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That explanation is not established by applying the division, because there is no application.

original: byed pa dang bral bas kyang rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa dang bral bas kyang rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not complete because of the absence of activity,

original: de nas yang de la yang dag par sbyor ba'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas yang de la yang dag par sbyor ba'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no meaning of correct application to that.

original: bden pa gnyi ga dbyer med pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa gnyi ga dbyer med pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not because of the inseparability of the two truths,

original: 'dis rgyud 'di bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rgyud 'di bye brag tu 'chad par byed pa spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: because this is not the domain of one who explains this tantra.

original: de ni rgyud do //
analyzed: de ni rgyud do //
translated: That is the tantra.

original: bdag gis bshad ni /
analyzed: bdag gis bshad ni /
translated: I have explained

original: bdag gi tshig kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi tshig kho na'i yul yin gyi gzhan gyi ni yul ma yin no //
translated: the domain of my words alone, not the domain of others.

original: de nyon ni thos pa'i spyod yul du gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: de nyon ni thos pa'i spyod yul du gyis shig pa ste /
translated: Listen to that, make it the domain of hearing.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang tha mi dad pa'i sku gsum skyed par byed pas na /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang tha mi dad pa'i sku gsum skyed par byed pas na /
translated: Because it generates the three bodies that are not different from the enjoyment body,

original: theg pa chen po'i gsang sngags mchog nyid 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gsang sngags mchog nyid 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: This is the greatness of the supreme secret mantra of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: And it will be explained:

original: rgyud kun gyi ni tshul shes nas //
analyzed: rgyud kun gyi ni tshul shes nas //
translated: Having understood the method of all tantras,

original: phyi nas dgyes pa'i rdo rje brtsam //
analyzed: phyi nas dgyes pa'i rdo rje brtsam //
translated: Afterwards, one should compose the Hevajra Tantra.

original: zhes pa'o // sku gsum tha mi dad pa nyid rtogs par byed pa bden pa gnyis kyi rim pas bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sku gsum tha mi dad pa nyid rtogs par byed pa bden pa gnyis kyi rim pas bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: Desiring to teach the realization of the indivisibility of the three bodies through the stages of the two truths, it is said:🔽The gaze, summoning, great symbol,🔽accomplishing the purpose, the many awarenesses,

original: lta stangs dgug dang brda chen dang // don byed rnam mang rig pa dang // zhes pa'i lta stangs dgug pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa 'di yang /
analyzed: lta stangs dgug dang brda chen dang // don byed rnam mang rig pa dang // zhes pa'i lta stangs dgug pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa 'di yang /
translated: and the gaze, summoning, and so forth, are explained

original: le'u gzhan las rab tu grags pa nyid do //
analyzed: le'u gzhan las rab tu grags pa nyid do //
translated: in other chapters.

original: gzhan yang / lta stangs ni lta ba'i ye shes te thugs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / lta stangs ni lta ba'i ye shes te thugs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the gaze is the wisdom of seeing, the aspect of mind.

original: @10b dgug pa ni dgug pa ste /
analyzed: @10b dgug pa ni dgug pa ste /
translated: Summoning is summoning,

original: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa 'dus pa la dgug pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir sku'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa 'dus pa la dgug pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir sku'i rnam pa'o //
translated: because the nature of summoning is the gathering of objects, sense faculties, and so forth, it is the aspect of body.

original: brda chen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brda chen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called great symbol

original: brda chen po ste mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos las mtshan mar ston pas na gsung gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: brda chen po ste mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos las mtshan mar ston pas na gsung gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The great sign is the nature of signlessness, and the form of speech is the teaching of signs.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i don byed pa'i don ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i don byed pa'i don ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the performance of such an action is the ultimate truth.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mnyam pa'i phyir dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i phyir dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams so //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are equal and indivisible.

original: de'i dngos po ni don byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni don byed pa'o //
translated: Their entity is the performance of action.

original: de'i rnam mang ni rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: de'i rnam mang ni rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: Their variety is the various forms.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽de'i rig pa ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no // de'i rig pa ni shes pa ste /
translated: They are the nature of conventional truth.🔽The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the ultimate truth.

original: ye shes kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rengs par byed dang skrod pa nyid //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i don to // rengs par byed dang skrod pa nyid //
translated: It is certain because it is the form of intuition and because it is the ultimate truth.🔽The various forms of action are🔽paralysis, banishment,🔽and the destruction of the army,

original: sde rengs byed dang mngon spyod dang / zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sde rengs byed dang mngon spyod dang / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the destruction of the enemy.

original: don rab tu grags pa'i don de gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don rab tu grags pa'i don de gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the well-known terms is just as it is expressed.

original: don gzhan yang rengs pa smos pas g-yo ba med pa nyid de bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: don gzhan yang rengs pa smos pas g-yo ba med pa nyid de bsdu ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “paralysis” is immobility, which is included in the “binding” [mudrā].

original: skrod pa'i sgras spro ba'o //
analyzed: skrod pa'i sgras spro ba'o //
translated: The word “expulsion” is for the “expansion” [mudrā].

original: sde rengs byed pa smos pas /
analyzed: sde rengs byed pa smos pas /
translated: The mention of “binding the army”

original: sde ni dbang po la sogs pa'i dpung ste de rnams kyi tshogs la sde'o //
analyzed: sde ni dbang po la sogs pa'i dpung ste de rnams kyi tshogs la sde'o //
translated: is the army of the senses, etc. , and their collection is the “army.”

original: 'di'i rang bzhin g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis na rengs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin g-yo ba med pa nyid kyis na rengs pa'o //
translated: Since its nature is immobility, it is “binding.”

original: de nyid mngon pa nyid du thams cad du spyod cing spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mngon pa nyid du thams cad du spyod cing spro ba'i rang bzhin gyis kyang gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is also “expansion” in the sense of being engaged in all things in the nature of manifest enlightenment.

original: sde rengs byed dang mngon spyod kyi nges tshig go //
analyzed: sde rengs byed dang mngon spyod kyi nges tshig go //
translated: This is the explanation of the terms “binding the army” and “manifest activity.”

original: lta stangs dgug pa la sogs pa dang rengs par byed pa dang skrod pa la sogs pas ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sku gsum dang sku gsum tha mi dad pa nyid ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lta stangs dgug pa la sogs pa dang rengs par byed pa dang skrod pa la sogs pas ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sku gsum dang sku gsum tha mi dad pa nyid ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: By means of the nine gazes, summoning, etc., and binding, expelling, etc., the three bodies, which are of the nature of the five gnoses, and the five gnoses, which are of the nature of the three bodies, are inseparable.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: ji ltar rigs par rnal 'byor ma'i //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par rnal 'byor ma'i //
translated: As is appropriate, the yoginīs

original: skye dang gnas dang byed rgyu dang // zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma ste bdag med ma la sogs pa bco nga'o //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang byed rgyu dang // zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor ma ste bdag med ma la sogs pa bco nga'o //
translated: are the fifteen aspects of the yoginī.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is this?

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / de'i yan lag yul lnga po rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyi ga 'dus pa las byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lnga po 'di ni bco lnga ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang / de'i yan lag yul lnga po rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyi ga 'dus pa las byung ba'i bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes lnga po 'di ni bco lnga ste /
translated: The fifteen aspects are the five objects, the five aggregates of form, etc., and the five pristine awarenesses that have the nature of bliss, etc., which arise from the union of both the object and subject.

original: 'di rnams tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: Since these are not different, they are yoginīs.

original: de la ji ltar rigs pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rigs pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: In that regard, the proper order is as follows.

original: skye dang gnas dang byed rgyu ni cha med pas 'jig pa'i @11a * //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang byed rgyu ni cha med pas 'jig pa'i @11a * //
translated: Birth, abiding, and causal activity are the fifteen aspects of the yoginī.🔽Since they have the nature of destruction, they are partless.

original: rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / de dag gi skyed pa dang gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi phyir dang / de dag gi skyed pa dang gnas pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since their production and abiding are not perceived,

original: gnyi ga rgyu nye bar dgod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu nye bar dgod par bya dgos so //
translated: both must be posited as causes.

original: 'dis ni gang skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni gnas pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni gnas pa'i yang yin te /
translated: This shows that whatever is the cause of origination is also the cause of duration,

original: gnyi ga yang rgyu gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rgyu gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because both have the same cause.🔽Since both origination and duration are not separate from destruction,

original: gnyi ga yang 'jig pa las gud na med pa'i phyir na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig par gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang 'jig pa las gud na med pa'i phyir na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig par gyur du zin kyang /
translated: even though origination, duration, and destruction occur,

original: rgyu gcig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gcig pa kho na yin te /
translated: they have the same cause,

original: gsum ka yang rgyu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum ka yang rgyu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all three have the same cause.

original: de kho na nyid du na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba yan lag can yod pa ma yin pa 'di nyid rnal 'byor rim pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang / nus mthu ye shes rnam shes dang // lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba yan lag can yod pa ma yin pa 'di nyid rnal 'byor rim pa yin no // gzhan yang / nus mthu ye shes rnam shes dang // lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba'o //
translated: In reality, since there is no intrinsic reality of cause and effect, this very absence of a relation of inherence between cause and effect is the stage of yoga.🔽Moreover, it is said:🔽The power of knowledge, consciousness,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and the arising of the gods.

original: ye shes ni rtogs pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni rtogs pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is realization, which is conventional truth.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de las 'das pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de las 'das pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is beyond that, which is ultimate truth.

original: ye shes nyid rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: ye shes nyid rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Knowledge itself is consciousness.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of ultimate reality is the very same relative truth.

original: de nyid lha rnams te gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid lha rnams te gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung ba'o //
translated: That itself is the deities, just as form and so forth occur.

original: de nyid kyi nus mthu ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi nus mthu ni /
translated: The power of that is

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje bstan pa yin no //
translated: the teaching of the nondual, indivisible Hevajra.🔽That itself is

original: de nyid / he ru ka ni bskyed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de nyid / he ru ka ni bskyed pa'i rgyu //
translated: the cause of generating Heruka.

original: dang por gcig ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dang por gcig ni bsgom par bya //
translated: First, one should meditate on the one.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said.

original: he ru ka'i bskyed pa ni he ru ka bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: he ru ka'i bskyed pa ni he ru ka bskyed pa ste /
translated: The generation of Heruka is the generation of Heruka.

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / stong pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / stong pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: The signs, the wishless, and the empty arise.

original: de'i rgyu ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that is the cause.

original: gcig nyid ni //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni //
translated: The one is

original: gnyis su med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid do //
translated: nonduality.

original: bsgom par bya ni dang po re zhig gang sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ni dang po re zhig gang sgom pa'o //
translated: One should meditate on the first, which is what is meditated on.

original: de nas dang por re zhig ni gzhan la ltos pa med par bstan pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dang por re zhig ni gzhan la ltos pa med par bstan pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Then, first, is the sequence of the teaching without depending on another.

original: gcig ces pa ci /
analyzed: gcig ces pa ci /
translated: What is the one?

original: ma ning du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma ning du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of becoming neuter.

original: gcig gis zla bo med par ston te zla med pa yang gcig kyang med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gcig gis zla bo med par ston te zla med pa yang gcig kyang med pa yin pas so //
translated: One shows that there is no companion, and that there is no companion because there is no second.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa can gyi lta ba thams cad rnam par bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa can gyi lta ba thams cad rnam par bcad pa yin no //
translated: This is the exclusion of all views of the objectifiers.

original: de nyid // rdo rje snying po snying po che //
analyzed: de nyid // rdo rje snying po snying po che //
translated: That itself is the vajra essence, the great essence.

original: dngos po nyid kyis rnam grol cing //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyis rnam grol cing //
translated: It is liberated by its very reality,

original: zhes pa ste dngos po nyid 'khor ba yin la de nyid grol ba skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste dngos po nyid 'khor ba yin la de nyid grol ba skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: and that very reality is samsara, which is the producer of liberation.

original: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i pha rol na grol ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba las 'das pa'i pha rol na grol ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no liberation beyond the other side of samsara.

original: de nyid rdo rje snying po snying rje che //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje snying po snying rje che //
translated: That itself is the vajra essence, the great compassion.

original: zhes pa ni khyad par dang bcas pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyad par dang bcas pa bod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement with a distinction.

original: rdo rje snying po nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i @11b don to //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po nyid kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'i @11b don to //
translated: The vajra essence itself is the meaning of the ultimate truth.

original: snying rje che nyid kyis ni de nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje che nyid kyis ni de nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: The great compassion itself is the conventional truth.

original: gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said:

original: 'khor ba he ru ka yi tshul //
analyzed: 'khor ba he ru ka yi tshul //
translated: Samsara is the mode of Heruka.

original: 'gro ba sgrol byar byed pa'i gtso //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgrol byar byed pa'i gtso //
translated: It is the chief of those who liberate beings.

original: zhes pa'o // de ji ltar 'ching bar 'gyur ba gsungs pa //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ji ltar 'ching bar 'gyur ba gsungs pa //
translated: He states how one is bound:

original: dngos po'i 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur //
translated: One is bound by the fetter of things.

original: de yongs shes pas grol ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yongs shes pas grol ba yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One is liberated by the thorough knowledge of that.

original: dngos po'i 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur //
translated: One is bound by the fetter of things.

original: zhes pa ni dngos po nyid grol ba'i tshul du brtags nas thar pa'i rtog pas 'ching bas bcings nas slar yang srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos po nyid grol ba'i tshul du brtags nas thar pa'i rtog pas 'ching bas bcings nas slar yang srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one is bound by the conception of liberation through the imagination of things themselves, one is bound by the conception of liberation and again comes to be in cyclic existence.

original: de yongs shes ba grol ba yin //
analyzed: de yongs shes ba grol ba yin //
translated: One is liberated by the thorough knowledge of that.

original: zhes pa ni thar pa yongs su shes pa nyid kyis grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thar pa yongs su shes pa nyid kyis grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: One is liberated by the thorough knowledge of liberation itself.

original: 'dis ni thar pa'i rtog pa yang 'ching ba la //
analyzed: 'dis ni thar pa'i rtog pa yang 'ching ba la //
translated: This shows that the conception of liberation is a fetter,

original: 'ching ba'i rtog pa yang thar pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i rtog pa yang thar pa yin no //
translated: and the conception of a fetter is liberation.

original: de'i phyir 'ching ba dang thar pa gnyi ga yang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ching ba dang thar pa gnyi ga yang ltos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, both bondage and liberation are relational.

original: ltos pa med pa'i don la ni 'ching ba yang med la thar pa yang med do //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i don la ni 'ching ba yang med la thar pa yang med do //
translated: But in the case of an object that is not relational, there is neither bondage nor liberation.

original: dngos po med pa yongs shes pas //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yongs shes pas //
translated: One is liberated by the thorough knowledge of the absence of things.

original: dngos po sgom 'gyur shes rab can //
analyzed: dngos po sgom 'gyur shes rab can //
translated: The wise one meditates on the real and the unreal.

original: zhes bya ba la dngos po ni kun rdzob po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos po ni kun rdzob po //
translated: The real is the conventional.

original: dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The unreal is the ultimate.

original: gnyi ga yang snyoms par 'jug par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang snyoms par 'jug par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on both in meditative equipoise.

original: 'gyur ba ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni skyed pa'o //
translated: The real is the cause of the arising of the unreal.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas so //
translated: Through thorough knowledge.

original: thams cad du yongs su shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du yongs su shes pa nyid yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: Thorough knowledge is the thorough knowledge of everything.

original: mi shigs pa'i rang bzhin der gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shigs pa'i rang bzhin der gnas pa yin no //
translated: One abides in that nature which is indestructible.

original: de nyid shes rab can zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab can zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the one who knows thatness.

original: yang na dngos po cir 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na dngos po cir 'gyur /
translated: Or else, what is the real?

original: dngos po med pa ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The unreal is the nature of the non-arising of the real.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yongs su shes pas te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas te /
translated: Through thorough knowledge.

original: lhun gyis grub pas dbang du gyur pas so ;
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas dbang du gyur pas so ;
translated: One is in control through spontaneous accomplishment.

original: / bsgom par bya ba gang zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: / bsgom par bya ba gang zung du 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: What is to be meditated upon is the union which is to be accomplished.

original: yang na dngos po ni dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na dngos po ni dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the real is the unreal.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po yin pas dngos po gnyis pa'i ma ning ni he ru ka'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po yin pas dngos po gnyis pa'i ma ning ni he ru ka'o //
translated: Since the non-entity is also an entity, the neuter of the two entities is Heruka.

original: dngos po med kyang gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ning gi ste ;
analyzed: dngos po med kyang gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ning gi ste ;
translated: Even though non-entity, the non-entity of the Vajra dakini is inseparable from both.

original: de gnyis po gnyi gang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgom zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis po gnyi gang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgom zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: That pair should be cultivated and accomplished by the nature of union.

original: yongs su shes pa ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bstan zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bstan zin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “fully known” is omniscience.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that,🔽it is said:

original: gsungs pa / dngos po med pa yongs shes pas //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dngos po med pa yongs shes pas //
translated: By fully knowing the non-entity,

original: de ltar @12a * //🔽he ru ka bsgom bya //
analyzed: de ltar @12a * // he ru ka bsgom bya //
translated: thus

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Heruka should be cultivated.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgom par bya ba gang bsgrub par bya ba de yod pa yin pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gyis bsgom par bya ba gang bsgrub par bya ba de yod pa yin pa de ltar ro //
translated: That which is to be accomplished by the nature of union should be cultivated.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: he ru ka dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: he ru ka dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Heruka is not different from Nairātmya.

original: bdag med ma'i go 'phang de nyid dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma'i go 'phang de nyid dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The state of Nairātmya is itself the non-entity.

original: med pa ni bdag med ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa ni bdag med ma yin la /
translated: Non-existence is not the absence of self.

original: dngos po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa yin pas gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dngos po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa yin pas gnyi ga dbyer mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Existence is the vajra-holder. Thus, it is the gnosis of the inseparability of the two.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yongs shes pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs shes pas zhes pa ste /
translated: By perfect knowledge.

original: 'di'i don ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained.

original: 'dis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the gnosis of manifest complete enlightenment with the knowledge of all aspects by means of the nature of existence and non-existence,

original: bden pa gnyis su byar med pa'i de nyid rnam par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis su byar med pa'i de nyid rnam par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: in order to clarify the suchness of the two truths, which are not to be made dual, it is said:

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
translated: The great gnosis abides in the body,

original: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad yang dag spangs //
translated: completely abandoning all conceptual thoughts,

original: dngos po kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: pervading all things.

original: lus gnas lus las skyes pa min //
analyzed: lus gnas lus las skyes pa min //
translated: It does not abide in the body, nor is it born from the body.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lus ni lus te bsags pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni lus te bsags pa'o //
translated: The body is the body, the collection.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: It is the five appropriated aggregates, such as form, etc.

original: de la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas shing mi g-yo bas na lus la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid kyis gnas shing mi g-yo bas na lus la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is located in the body because it abides in the body, remaining in its own nature without moving.

original: ye shes chen po ni /
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni /
translated: Great intuition is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sdom pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sdom pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the intuition of the realization of the vow of the dakinis of all Tathagatas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽yang dag rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / yang dag rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: it is free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: Conceptual thought is right thought,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: the four noble truths, and so on.

original: thams cad ni ma lus par te 'dis ni bag la nyal gyi bag chags tshun chad do //🔽de spangs pa ni spangs pa ste /🔽dngos po'i rtog pa dang / dngos po med pa'i rtog pa dang / sgro btags kyi rtog pa dang / dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin zhes pa dang / de bzhin zhes pa dang / gcig dang du ma dang /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus par te 'dis ni bag la nyal gyi bag chags tshun chad do // de spangs pa ni spangs pa ste / dngos po'i rtog pa dang / dngos po med pa'i rtog pa dang / sgro btags kyi rtog pa dang / dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rtog pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin zhes pa dang / de bzhin zhes pa dang / gcig dang du ma dang /
translated: All means without exception, and this includes even the latent traces of the propensities.

original: spyi dang khyad par te /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par te /
translated: Free from conceptual thoughts means free from conceptual thoughts of entity, conceptual thoughts of non-entity, conceptual thoughts of superimposition, conceptual thoughts of exclusion, conceptual thoughts of just that, conceptual thoughts of just so, conceptual thoughts of one and many,🔽conceptual thoughts of universals and particulars,🔽and so on.

original: rtog pa rnam pa bcu spangs nas dor ba yin te shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun la khyab pa po ni don gnas pa de'i phyir na dngos po ste /
analyzed: rtog pa rnam pa bcu spangs nas dor ba yin te shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir dngos po kun la khyab pa po ni don gnas pa de'i phyir na dngos po ste /
translated: It is to be discarded by abandoning the ten conceptual thoughts, because it is the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhātu.🔽For that very reason, it pervades all things, because it is the basis of the meaning.

original: thams cad kyang de yin la /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is the thing,

original: dngos po yang de yin pas dngos po thams cad de /
analyzed: dngos po yang de yin pas dngos po thams cad de /
translated: because it is all that and it is a thing.

original: 'dod pa'i @12b khams la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i @12b khams la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: All things are the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres of the desire realm and so on.

original: de rnams kyi khyab pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi khyab pa ni /
translated: Their pervasion is

original: phan tshun du gzugs pa rnyen lta bur mtshungs pa des so //
analyzed: phan tshun du gzugs pa rnyen lta bur mtshungs pa des so //
translated: similar to mutual support.

original: slar yang lus las skyes pa min ni rgyu lus las skyes pa'i rgyu gzhan dang gzhan tshad mas grub pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: slar yang lus las skyes pa min ni rgyu lus las skyes pa'i rgyu gzhan dang gzhan tshad mas grub pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not born again from the body, because another cause born from the body is not established by valid knowledge.

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: It is considered to be primordially unborn.

original: de ni ye shes chen po lus 'di la gnas pa des dngos po thams cad la khyab pas dbyer mi phyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ye shes chen po lus 'di la gnas pa des dngos po thams cad la khyab pas dbyer mi phyed pa nyid do //
translated: Since that great pristine consciousness that exists in this body pervades all things, it is indivisible.

original: rdo rje snying pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba /
translated: Vajragarbha asked the Bhagavān:

original: kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i lus la rtsa du lags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i lus la rtsa du lags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “O Bhagavān, how many nāḍīs are there in the vajra body?”

original: lus dang ye shes chen po dag dbyer mi phyed pa des na rdo rje'i lus so //
analyzed: lus dang ye shes chen po dag dbyer mi phyed pa des na rdo rje'i lus so //
translated: Since the great body and pristine consciousness are indivisible, it is the vajra body.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Bhagavān” means

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i gter gcig pu de /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa'i gter gcig pu de /
translated: the sole treasure of all qualities, such as lordship.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zil gyis mi gnon pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dbang du gyur nas /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i sgrib pa zil gyis mi gnon pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dbang du gyur nas /
translated: Since the obscurations of the various kinds of consciousness and objects of consciousness are overcome, having become the power of omniscience,

original: thugs su chud pas bka' stsal ba'i skabs 'dir bod par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs su chud pas bka' stsal ba'i skabs 'dir bod par rigs pa yin no //
translated: it is reasonable to explain the reply in this context.

original: rtsa du lags zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rtsa du lags zhes pa ni /
translated: “How many nāḍīs are there?”

original: zhus pa dang lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: zhus pa dang lan btab pa ste /
translated: is the question and reply.

original: rtsa'i sgra yis dkyil 'khor gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: rtsa'i sgra yis dkyil 'khor gnyis bstan te /
translated: The sound of the channels indicates the two mandalas.

original: dbyu gu gnyis la chu tshod gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu gnyis la chu tshod gang yin pa'o //
translated: The two half-hours are the hour.

original: du lags zhes pa ni du yod ces pa'o /
analyzed: du lags zhes pa ni du yod ces pa'o /
translated: How many? means how many are there?

original: skyes pa dang bud med tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na zhus te gsol pa /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med tha mi dad pa nyid kyis na zhus te gsol pa /
translated: Since there is no difference between male and female, he asked:

original: rtsa gsum ni mkha' 'gro ma yin na de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa du lags zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa gsum ni mkha' 'gro ma yin na de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa du lags zhes pa'o //
translated: If the three channels are the dakinis, how many tathagatas are there?

original: zhus pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhus pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied to that very question:

original: rtsa rnams ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsa rnams ni sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The channels are thirty-two.

original: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bad pa bde ba chen po'i gnas su 'dzag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bad pa bde ba chen po'i gnas su 'dzag pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The thirty-two bodhicitta bindus fall in the place of great bliss.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes brtan pas 'dzag pa spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa sprul par son pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yongs su gyur pa las sprul pa'i sku 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes brtan pas 'dzag pa spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas pa sprul par son pa de longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yongs su gyur pa las sprul pa'i sku 'bab pa'o //
translated: By the stability of perfect wisdom, the falling in the manner of emission is the emanation body. That falling is the enjoyment body.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa ste //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa ste //
translated: The thirty-two bodhicitta bindus fall.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni /
translated: The so-called bodhicitta

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i thig le dang n'a da dag tha mi dad pa las yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs yig bcu drug nyid thig le bcu drug yin no //🔽sku gnyis tha mi @13a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i thig le dang n'a da dag tha mi dad pa las yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs yig bcu drug nyid thig le bcu drug yin no // sku gnyis tha mi @13a * //
translated: is the sixteen vowels such as A, which are the sixteen bindus of the indivisible bindu and nada of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: dad pas byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa'o //
translated: Since the two kāyas are inseparable, the bodhicitta falls into thirty-two.

original: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid las byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid las byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa ste /
translated: The so-called thirty-two nāḍīs are the falling of the bodhicitta from those thirty-two.

original: sku gnyis tha mi dad pa'i sprul pa'i sku dang dbyer med pas drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis tha mi dad pa'i sprul pa'i sku dang dbyer med pas drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Since the nirmāṇakāya, which is inseparable from the two kāyas, is inseparable, there are sixty-four.

original: de la aa ba dh'u t'i ni rgyu mthun pa bdag med ma dbus na gnas so //
analyzed: de la aa ba dh'u t'i ni rgyu mthun pa bdag med ma dbus na gnas so //
translated: In that respect, the avadhūti is the middle, which is the homogeneous cause of Nairātmya.

original: rkyang ma dang ro ma ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin te /
analyzed: rkyang ma dang ro ma ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yin te /
translated: The lalanā and rasanā are the homogeneous cause of the four great elements.

original: byang chub kyi sems drug cu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems drug cu yin no //
translated: There are sixty bodhicittas.

original: rtsa gsum ni gcig pa des na /
analyzed: rtsa gsum ni gcig pa des na /
translated: Since the three nāḍīs are one,

original: sum cu ste /
analyzed: sum cu ste /
translated: there are thirty.

original: nyin zhag gcig la yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis drug cu yin no //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la yang thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis drug cu yin no //
translated: In a single day and night, there are sixty, by the nature of method and wisdom.🔽The waxing and waning phases, which have the nature of the first lunar day and so on up to the fifteenth lunar day, are the nature of the twelve links of dependent origination, by the nature of the moon and so on.

original: tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes bco lnga'i rang bzhin can yar ngo dang mar ngo gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid zla ba la sogs pa dus kyi bdag nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin khyim bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: tshes gcig la sogs pa tshes bco lnga'i rang bzhin can yar ngo dang mar ngo gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid zla ba la sogs pa dus kyi bdag nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin khyim bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve houses are the nature of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: Ignorance and so on are the condition of formation.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: The condition of formation is the condition of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: The condition of consciousness is the condition of name and form.🔽The condition of name and form is the condition of the six sense bases.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: The condition of the six sense bases is the condition of contact.🔽The condition of contact is the condition of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: The condition of feeling is the condition of craving.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: The condition of craving is the condition of grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: The condition of grasping is the condition of becoming.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: The condition of becoming is the condition of birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'o //
translated: Old age and death are conditioned by birth.

original: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mi dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mi dge ba rnams te /
translated: Here, ignorance is the misknowledge of suffering, selflessness, impermanence, and the unwholesome.

original: bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang dge bar sgro btags pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang dge bar sgro btags pa ni /
translated: The superimposition of pleasure, permanence, self, and the wholesome is the counteragent.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
