translated: The accumulation of the counteragent is action.🔽The ripening of that action is consciousness.🔽Consciousness is the cause of name-and-form.🔽Name-and-form is the cause of the six sense spheres.🔽The six sense spheres are the cause of contact.🔽Contact is the cause of feeling.🔽Feeling is the cause of craving.🔽Craving is the cause of grasping.🔽Grasping is the cause of becoming.🔽Becoming is the cause of birth.🔽Birth is the cause of old age and death.🔽Here, ignorance is the misknowledge of suffering, selflessness, impermanence, and the unwholesome.

original: bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dge bar sgro btags pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang / dge bar sgro btags pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsags pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'du byed do //
translated: The superimposition of pleasure, permanence, self, and the wholesome is the counteragent.🔽The accumulation of the counteragent is action.

original: las de rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: las de rnam par smin pa las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The ripening of that action is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la brten nas ming dang gzugs so ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la brten nas ming dang gzugs so ;
translated: Consciousness is the cause of name-and-form.🔽Name-and-form is the cause of the six sense spheres.🔽The six sense spheres are the cause of contact.🔽Contact is the cause of feeling.🔽Feeling is the cause of craving.

original: / ming dang gzugs las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga byung la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang lhan cig pa'i sems skye mched drug go //
analyzed: / ming dang gzugs las nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga byung la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang lhan cig pa'i sems skye mched drug go //
translated: Craving is the cause of grasping.🔽Grasping is the cause of becoming.🔽Becoming is the cause of birth.🔽Birth is the cause of old age and death.

original: skye mched drug las yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum rnams zag pa dang bcas par sgro btags pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug las yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum rnams zag pa dang bcas par sgro btags pa rig pa'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the designation of the three, the object, the sense faculty, and consciousness, as contaminated.

original: reg pa dang 'dus @13b pa las byung ba tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang 'dus @13b pa las byung ba tshor ba'o //
translated: Contact is the coming together of the three. Feeling is what arises from contact.

original: tshor ba rtag tu chags pa las sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rtag tu chags pa las sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the constant attachment to feeling.

original: sred pa 'phel ba las len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa 'phel ba las len pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the increase of craving.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang de 'dus pa las srid pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang de 'dus pa las srid pa'o //
translated: Becoming is the five aggregates of form, etc.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa skye ba'o //
translated: Birth is the arising of the homogeneous cause of that.

original: de yongs su smin pa las rgas shing 'khogs pa'i phung po dang tha mi dad pa'i 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: de yongs su smin pa las rgas shing 'khogs pa'i phung po dang tha mi dad pa'i 'chi ba'o //
translated: Aging and death is the decay of that, which is not different from the aggregates.

original: 'dis ni yang ma rig pa la sogs pa dang tshes gcig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang ma rig pa la sogs pa dang tshes gcig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, ignorance, etc. are like the first of the month, etc.

original: gsum pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bcu gsum mo //
translated: The third is like the thirteenth.

original: ji ltar bzhin pa de ltar bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhin pa de ltar bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is like the fourteenth.

original: ji ltar lnga pa de ltar bco lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar lnga pa de ltar bco lnga pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is like the fifteenth.

original: tshes grangs gsum tshes grangs bcu gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshes grangs gsum tshes grangs bcu gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The three numbers are included in the twelve numbers.

original: de la tshes gcig ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la tshes gcig ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The first day is the gnosis of nonduality.

original: gnyis pa ni thabs dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thabs dang shes rab bo //
translated: The second is method and wisdom.

original: gsum pa ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The third is body, speech, and mind.

original: bzhi pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The fourth is the four great elements.

original: lnga pa ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The fifth is the five gnoses.

original: drug pa ni ye shes lnga dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni ye shes lnga dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the vajra holder, who is not different from the five gnoses.

original: bdun pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The seventh is method and wisdom, which are not different.

original: brgyad pa ni de nyid sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni de nyid sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The eighth is that very [vajra holder] as body, speech, and mind.

original: dgu pa ni 'byung ba chen po lnga dang tha mi dad pa'i ye shes lnga rnams so //
analyzed: dgu pa ni 'byung ba chen po lnga dang tha mi dad pa'i ye shes lnga rnams so //
translated: The ninth is the five gnoses, which are not different from the five great elements.

original: bcu pa ni lnga po gnyi gar tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa ni lnga po gnyi gar tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the two sets of five, which are not different.

original: bcu gcig pa ni ye shes lnga gnyi ga yang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa ni ye shes lnga gnyi ga yang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The eleventh is the nature of the two sets of five, which is nondual.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni /
translated: The twelfth is

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin des so //
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin des so //
translated: that very [eleventh], which is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: bcu gsum pa ni de nyid sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid des so //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa ni de nyid sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid des so //
translated: The thirteenth is that very [twelfth], which is the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: bcu bzhi pa ni de nyid 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa ni de nyid 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The fourteenth is because of the nature of the four great elements.

original: bco lnga pa ni lnga po tha mi dad pas rnal 'byor ma bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa ni lnga po tha mi dad pas rnal 'byor ma bco lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the fifteenth yoginī because of the indivisibility of the five.

original: de nyid 'char ba dang nub pa'i rang bzhin des tshes grangs sum cu'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'char ba dang nub pa'i rang bzhin des tshes grangs sum cu'o //
translated: That very one is the thirty digits because of the nature of the rising and setting of the moon.

original: tshes grangs sum cu rnams dang yang tshes gcig tha mi dad do //
analyzed: tshes grangs sum cu rnams dang yang tshes gcig tha mi dad do //
translated: The thirty digits are also indivisible from the first digit.

original: tshes grangs kyi rang bzhin de la yang dbang du bya ba dang longs spyod pa dang thim pa'i rang bzhin rnams mkha' 'gro ma drug cu'o //
analyzed: tshes grangs kyi rang bzhin de la yang dbang du bya ba dang longs spyod pa dang thim pa'i rang bzhin rnams mkha' 'gro ma drug cu'o //
translated: The sixty ḍākinīs are the nature of the digits, which have the nature of being controlled, enjoyed, and dissolved.

original: nyin zhag gcig gi dbyu gu'i grangs kyis rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig gi dbyu gu'i grangs kyis rnam par gnas so //
translated: They are situated by the number of ghaṭikās in a day.

original: ka la sogs pa sde tshan lnga rnams dang yi ge ma la sogs pa'i sde tshan lnga po rnams go rims las zlog pa dang / sa aapa sha sha thaaka aak'a sh'a sha aap'a sa 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin rnams dang mthe bong la sogs @14a * //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa sde tshan lnga rnams dang yi ge ma la sogs pa'i sde tshan lnga po rnams go rims las zlog pa dang / sa aapa sha sha thaaka aak'a sh'a sha aap'a sa 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin rnams dang mthe bong la sogs @14a * //
translated: The five classes beginning with ka and the five classes beginning with ma are reversed, and sa, pa, śa, ṣa, ha, kṣa, a, ā, i, ī, u, ū, ṛ, ṝ, ḷ, ḹ, e, ai, o, au, aṃ, aḥ, ya, ra, la, va, śa, ṣa, sa, ha, kṣa, these are the natures of the five transcendent lords.

original: pa sor mo lnga po rnams la 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin lag pa g-yas la sogs pa nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i bar du so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin des tshigs rnams la mtha' yas so //
analyzed: pa sor mo lnga po rnams la 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin lag pa g-yas la sogs pa nas rkang pa g-yas pa'i bar du so sor rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin des tshigs rnams la mtha' yas so //
translated: The fingers beginning with the thumb have the nature of the four great elements. In the right hand, etc., up to the right foot, they are the natures of the three vajras.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i rkang pa la sogs pa g-yon pa'i lag pa'i bar du de ltar mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i rkang pa la sogs pa g-yon pa'i lag pa'i bar du de ltar mtha' yas so //
translated: In the same way, in the left foot, etc., up to the left hand, they are the natures of the three vajras.

original: mdun dang rgyab dang logs gnyis su 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams yin la dbus su bdag med ma yin no //
analyzed: mdun dang rgyab dang logs gnyis su 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams yin la dbus su bdag med ma yin no //
translated: In the front, back, and two sides, there are the four great elements, and in the middle, Nairātmya.🔽By that nature of a single day and night, the day is the Lord,

original: nyin zhag gcig gi rang bzhin des na nyin mo ni bcom ldan 'das yin la //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig gi rang bzhin des na nyin mo ni bcom ldan 'das yin la //
translated: and the night is the Lady.

original: mtshan mo ni shes rab po //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni shes rab po //
translated: Night is wisdom.

original: 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba las /
translated: This will be explained:

original: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: Day is the Bhagavān Vajrī,

original: rnal 'byor ma ni mtshan mor bshad //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni mtshan mor bshad //
translated: and night is said to be the yoginī.

original: ces pa'o // de nyid zhag bco lnga las zla ba phyed de yar ngo ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de nyid zhag bco lnga las zla ba phyed de yar ngo ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That very [night] is fifteen days, half a month. The bright fortnight is Vajradhara,

original: mar ngo'i bdag nyid gzhan zla phyed bdag med ma yin la /
analyzed: mar ngo'i bdag nyid gzhan zla phyed bdag med ma yin la /
translated: and the other half-month, which is the nature of the dark fortnight, is Nairātmya.

original: zla phyed gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni zla ba la de nyid ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi lo'o //
analyzed: zla phyed gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni zla ba la de nyid ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi lo'o //
translated: The fortnight that is the nature of both is the month, which has the nature of the twelve links of dependent origination beginning with ignorance.

original: de nyid zla ba gnyis kyi chas dbye bas dus drug ste /
analyzed: de nyid zla ba gnyis kyi chas dbye bas dus drug ste /
translated: That very [month] is divided by the two parts of the moon into six seasons.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yin par mtshungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin yin par mtshungs so //
translated: They are equal in being the nature of Vajrasattva and the five tathāgatas.

original: zla ba drug drug gi ldog mtshams gnyis te /
analyzed: zla ba drug drug gi ldog mtshams gnyis te /
translated: There are two reversals of the six months each.

original: gnyi ga yang de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Both are suchness.

original: de la de bzhin nyid sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dbugs gcig yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dbugs gcig yin no //
translated: In this, there is one breath, which is the nature of the thirty-two realities.

original: de nyid sum brgya drug cu'i bdag nyid dbyu gu ste bstan pa'i ka la sogs pa sum cu dang go bzlog pa'i aaka la sogs pa sum cu'o //
analyzed: de nyid sum brgya drug cu'i bdag nyid dbyu gu ste bstan pa'i ka la sogs pa sum cu dang go bzlog pa'i aaka la sogs pa sum cu'o //
translated: That itself is the muhurta, which has the nature of three hundred and sixty [breaths], thirty [breaths] of the forward order of the vowels a, ā, and so on, and thirty [breaths] of the reverse order of aḥ, āḥ, and so on.

original: de ltar dbyu gu drug cu la rlung nyi khri tshig stong drug brgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbyu gu drug cu la rlung nyi khri tshig stong drug brgya'o //
translated: Thus, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths in sixty muhurtas.

original: lo la yang dbyu gu 'di nyid do //🔽'dis ni lo re la dbyu gu ji snyed pa de snyed du nyin zhag gcig la dbugs so //
analyzed: lo la yang dbyu gu 'di nyid do // 'dis ni lo re la dbyu gu ji snyed pa de snyed du nyin zhag gcig la dbugs so //
translated: In a year, there are also this many muhurtas.🔽This means that in each year, there are as many breaths as there are muhurtas.

original: lo re la nyi ma ji tsam yod pa de tsam du dbyu gu gcig la dbugs yod pa yin no //
analyzed: lo re la nyi ma ji tsam yod pa de tsam du dbyu gu gcig la dbugs yod pa yin no //
translated: In each year, there are as many breaths as there are days.

original: 'khor lo bzhi la 'pho ba bcu drug gis dbugs gcig yin te ;
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi la 'pho ba bcu drug gis dbugs gcig yin te ;
translated: In the four cakras, there is one breath for each of the sixteen movements.

original: dbugs kyi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi 'pho ba'o //
translated: This is the movement of the breath.

original: de ltar 'char ba dang nub pa dang / gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis srid pa gsum tha mi dad cing cha med pa'i kun du bzang po rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba bzhi po rnams la rgyu skar bdun bdun ldan pa sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid des na tha skar @14b la
analyzed: de ltar 'char ba dang nub pa dang / gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis srid pa gsum tha mi dad cing cha med pa'i kun du bzang po rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba bzhi po rnams la rgyu skar bdun bdun ldan pa sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid des na tha skar @14b la
translated: As such, the three existences are undifferentiated and partless due to the nature of arising, setting, and abiding. The nature of the twenty-eight lunar mansions is the four elements. Since each of the four elements possesses seven lunar mansions, the nature of the four combinations is that of the lunar mansion Hasta.🔽

original: sogs pa'i rim pas gnas bzhi rnams la lan bdun bdun ldabs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rim pas gnas bzhi rnams la lan bdun bdun ldabs par shes par bya'o //
translated: As such, the three existences are undifferentiated and partless due to the nature of arising, setting, and abiding. The nature of the twenty-eight lunar mansions is the four elements. Since each of the four elements possesses seven lunar mansions, the four unions are understood to be the seven repetitions of the four abodes, such as Hasta and so on.

original: rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang / kun 'dar ma dang / bu mo ste rtsa bzhi nyid sbyor ba bzhi'i yin par bya'o //🔽de nyid sbyor ba bzhi yin te /
analyzed: rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang / kun 'dar ma dang / bu mo ste rtsa bzhi nyid sbyor ba bzhi'i yin par bya'o // de nyid sbyor ba bzhi yin te /
translated: The four nāḍīs are the four unions: the lalanā, the rasanā, the avadhūti, and the girl.

original: sbyor ba bzhi dang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi dang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: Those are the four unions because they are undifferentiated from the four unions.

original: tshogs brgyad dang gza' brgyad kyang yin te /
analyzed: tshogs brgyad dang gza' brgyad kyang yin te /
translated: The eight collections and the eight planets are also like that.

original: nyi ma ni shes rab po //
analyzed: nyi ma ni shes rab po //
translated: The sun is wisdom.

original: zla ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: zla ba ni thabs so //
translated: The moon is method.

original: mig dmar la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mig dmar la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: Mars and so on are the five tathāgatas.

original: sgra gcan ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Rāhu is Vajradhara.

original: dus mtha' dag nyid la kun du bzang pos khyab pa yin pas rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa bla ma dam pa'i bka' drin las 'bad pa med par rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur 'khril bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus mtha' dag nyid la kun du bzang pos khyab pa yin pas rga ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa bla ma dam pa'i bka' drin las 'bad pa med par rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur 'khril bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since all times are pervaded by Samantabhadra, the concepts that generate aging, death, and sorrow are embraced in the form of a vajra holder without effort through the kindness of the holy guru.

original: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Those thirty-two nāḍīs are the nature of sixty-four because of the nature of method and prajñā.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi par brjod do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi par brjod do //
translated: The maṇḍala of emanation is said to have sixty-four petals.

original: de dag nyid tha mi dad pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par brjod do //
analyzed: de dag nyid tha mi dad pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par brjod do //
translated: Those are said to be the maṇḍala of great bliss with thirty-two petals.

original: de nyid stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin dbyangs bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin dbyangs bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug par brjod do //
translated: That is said to be the maṇḍala of enjoyment with sixteen petals, the nature of the sixteen vowels, which are the nature of the sixteen emptinesses.

original: de nyid ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin chos kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin chos kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is said to be the wheel of Dharma with eight petals, which is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses and three kāyas.

original: yang na nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Or, the Bhagavān taught that a day is divided into sixty-four nāḍīs.

original: de'i rang bzhin des na 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin des na 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: Since that is its nature, there are sixty-four petals.

original: 'di nyid bla ma'i rim pas las brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bla ma'i rim pas las brgyud pa'o //
translated: This is the lineage of the guru’s activity.🔽Since that is the indivisibility of method and wisdom, there are thirty-two petals in the nature of thirty-two nāḍīs.

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pas dbyu gu gnyis kyis chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi de nyid dbyu gu bzhis 'pho bas dbyangs bcu drug gi rang bzhin dag la 'dab ma bcu drug
analyzed: de nyid thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pas dbyu gu gnyis kyis chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi de nyid dbyu gu bzhis 'pho bas dbyangs bcu drug gi rang bzhin dag la 'dab ma bcu drug
translated: Since that is the sixteen movements in the sixteen vowels, there are sixteen petals.

original: go // de nyid dbyu gu brgyad brgyad kyis thun brgyad tshang pas padma 'dab ma brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: go // de nyid dbyu gu brgyad brgyad kyis thun brgyad tshang pas padma 'dab ma brgyad pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the eight periods of the day completed by eight nāḍīs, there are eight petals.

original: de la yang thun gnyis gnyis kyis thun mtshams bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la yang thun gnyis gnyis kyis thun mtshams bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, the two periods of the day are the four junctions.

original: bde chen gyi lte ba'i padma'i 'dab ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: bde chen gyi lte ba'i padma'i 'dab ma bzhi'o //
translated: The four petals of the lotus in the center of great bliss.

original: de la yang thun bzhi bzhi po des nyin zhag phrugs gcig go //
analyzed: de la yang thun bzhi bzhi po des nyin zhag phrugs gcig go //
translated: And in each of those, by the four periods, one day and night.

original: de gnyi ga tha mi dad pas nyin zhag tha mi dad cing gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje padma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de gnyi ga tha mi dad pas nyin zhag tha mi dad cing gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje padma zhes brjod do //
translated: Since those two are not different, the indivisible day and night are called the indivisible, nondual vajra lotus.

original: de nyid sna tshogs padma sna tshogs rdo @15a * //
analyzed: de nyid sna tshogs padma sna tshogs rdo @15a * //
translated: That itself is the variegated lotus, marked with variegated vajras.

original: rjes mtshan pa chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi gzhal yas khang zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rjes mtshan pa chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi gzhal yas khang zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the immeasurable palace of the source of phenomena.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: de rnams kyi nang nas rtsa gsum ni gtso mo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas rtsa gsum ni gtso mo ste /
translated: Among those, the three principal channels are

original: rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang / kun 'dar ma'o zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang / kun 'dar ma'o zhes pa smos te /
translated: the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti.

original: rkyang ma shes rab rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rkyang ma shes rab rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The lalanā is the nature of wisdom,

original: ro ma thabs kyis yang dag gnas //
analyzed: ro ma thabs kyis yang dag gnas //
translated: and the rasanā is the perfect method.

original: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su //🔽gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: The avadhūti is in the center,

original: zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes pa smos so //
translated: free from the duality of apprehended and apprehender.

original: rkyang ma shes rab rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rkyang ma shes rab rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The lalanā is the nature of wisdom,

original: zhes pa ni cha shas kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba des so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni cha shas kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba des so //
translated: This is because it is free from the nature of parts.

original: ro ma thabs kyis zhes pa ni cha dang bcas pa'i dngos po de'o //
analyzed: ro ma thabs kyis zhes pa ni cha dang bcas pa'i dngos po de'o //
translated: The “taste” is the method, which is that entity with parts.

original: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su //
analyzed: kun 'dar ma ni dbus gnas su //
translated: The “all-trembling” is in the middle.

original: zhes pa ni dbus kyi yul du bstan pas dbus gnas te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbus kyi yul du bstan pas dbus gnas te /
translated: This is because it is taught as the middle object.

original: gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Both are non-different.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: it is free from apprehended and apprehender.

original: zhes pa la gzung ba ni shes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la gzung ba ni shes bya'o //
translated: The apprehended is the object of knowledge.

original: 'dzin pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: The apprehender is the consciousness.

original: de'i spangs pa ni de gnyis ka yang tha mi dad par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spangs pa ni de gnyis ka yang tha mi dad par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Their abandonment is the non-difference of those two.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag bskyed bya skyed byed du yin pas sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos pos bden pa dang rnyed pa rnam par spangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag bskyed bya skyed byed du yin pas sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos pos bden pa dang rnyed pa rnam par spangs pa'i don to //
translated: Since consciousness and the object of consciousness are producer and produced, the meaning of abandoning truth and attainment is by the entity of earlier and later.

original: 'di nyid / mi bskyod 'bab pa rkyang ma ste //
analyzed: 'di nyid / mi bskyod 'bab pa rkyang ma ste //
translated: This is also

original: ro ma khrag ni 'bab pa'o //🔽shes rab zla ba 'bab bshad pa //
analyzed: ro ma khrag ni 'bab pa'o // shes rab zla ba 'bab bshad pa //
translated: the “taste” is the roma,

original: de ni kun 'dar ma rab grags //
analyzed: de ni kun 'dar ma rab grags //
translated: the “all-trembling” is the avadhūti.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is also🔽the “taste” is the roma,🔽the “all-trembling” is the avadhūti.

original: mi 'khrug cing mi g-yo bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'khrug cing mi g-yo bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Since it does not waver, it is immovable.

original: de 'bab pa yin pas mi bskyod pa rdo rje 'dzin pa de rtag tu 'bab pa nyid der gnas pas don dam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de 'bab pa yin pas mi bskyod pa rdo rje 'dzin pa de rtag tu 'bab pa nyid der gnas pas don dam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Since it always flows there, it is the nature of ultimate reality.

original: ro ma khrag ni 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: ro ma khrag ni 'bab pa'o //
translated: The rasanā is the flow of blood.

original: zhes pa ni khrag ni 'dod chags kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khrag ni 'dod chags kun du chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Since blood has the characteristic of passion and attachment, it is Amitābha.

original: de rtag tu 'bab pa nyid du der gnas pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid ni ro ma'o //
analyzed: de rtag tu 'bab pa nyid du der gnas pa'i rang bzhin kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid ni ro ma'o //
translated: Since it always flows there, it is the nature of the relative truth.

original: de bas na //
analyzed: de bas na //
translated: Therefore,

original: shes rab zla ba 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab zla ba 'bab pa ste /
translated: the flow of wisdom is the moon.

original: shes rab bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab bdag med ma'o //
translated: Wisdom is Nairātmya.

original: zla ba byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: zla ba byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The moon is bodhicitta.

original: rtag pa nyid du gnyi ga 'bab cing gnyi ga gnas pas bden pa gnyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du gnyi ga 'bab cing gnyi ga gnas pas bden pa gnyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Since both always flow and both abide there, it is the nature of the two truths, which are inseparable.

original: de nyid kun 'dar ma rab grags //
analyzed: de nyid kun 'dar ma rab grags //
translated: That is renowned as the lalanā.

original: zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsal bar bya ba'i don la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsal bar bya ba'i don la /
translated: The lalanā is renowned as the “great channel” because it is the meaning of the perfect buddha.

original: aa ba ni ngang gis lhun gyis grub pas dh'u t'i ste /
analyzed: aa ba ni ngang gis lhun gyis grub pas dh'u t'i ste /
translated: Ava is the dhūtī, because it is naturally spontaneously present.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mi shes pa 'joms pas kun 'dar @15b ma'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mi shes pa 'joms pas kun 'dar @15b ma'o //
translated: It is the kuṇḍalī, because it conquers the ignorance of afflictions and so on.

original: yang na aa ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na aa ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Alternatively, a is Nairātmya,

original: ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: va is Vajradhara,

original: gnyi ga ni dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni dh'u t'i'o //
translated: and both are the dhūtī.

original: g-yengs nas bcom zhing rang bzhin med pas na kun 'dar ma'o //
analyzed: g-yengs nas bcom zhing rang bzhin med pas na kun 'dar ma'o //
translated: Since it conquers by being distracted, it is the kuṇḍalī, because it is essenceless.

original: 'di ni rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang kun 'dar ma rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi dngos grub yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rkyang ma dang / ro ma dang kun 'dar ma rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid kyis mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi dngos grub yin no //
translated: This is the vajra of the three vajras of the lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti, which is the spiritual power of the ḍākinīs.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: It will also be explained:

original: srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
analyzed: srid gsum yongs gyur thams cad ni //
translated: All the transformations of the three existences

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: are free from the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: zhes pa'o // 'dis ni mi phyed pa la sogs pa'i rtsa 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin du zin kyang 'khor lo bzhir gyur pas gnas gzhan dang dngos po gzhan dang byed pa'i khyad par gsum 'byung bar man ngag gis brjod par bya ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'dis ni mi phyed pa la sogs pa'i rtsa 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin du zin kyang 'khor lo bzhir gyur pas gnas gzhan dang dngos po gzhan dang byed pa'i khyad par gsum 'byung bar man ngag gis brjod par bya ste //
translated: This is the nature of this channel, which is called “indivisible” and so on. But because it is present in the four chakras, it is taught in the esoteric instructions that there are three differences in location, substance, and function.

original: mi phyed ma ni mgo bor gnas //
analyzed: mi phyed ma ni mgo bor gnas //
translated: The indivisible channel is in the head.

original: so dang sen mo 'bar bar 'dod //
analyzed: so dang sen mo 'bar bar 'dod //
translated: It is said to cause the teeth and nails to grow.

original: phra gzugs ma ni spyi gtsug gnas //
analyzed: phra gzugs ma ni spyi gtsug gnas //
translated: The subtle form channel is in the fontanel.

original: skra dang ba spu 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: skra dang ba spu 'bab pa yin //
translated: It causes the hair and body hair to grow.

original: mdzes ma rna ba g-yas par gnas //
analyzed: mdzes ma rna ba g-yas par gnas //
translated: The beautiful channel is in the right ear.

original: pags pa dri ma 'bab par bshad //
analyzed: pags pa dri ma 'bab par bshad //
translated: It is said to cause the skin and dirt to flow.

original: g-yon pa ma ni ltag khung gnas //
analyzed: g-yon pa ma ni ltag khung gnas //
translated: The left one is in the nape of the neck.

original: sha ni rtag tu 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: sha ni rtag tu 'bab pa yin //
translated: It causes the flesh to always flow.

original: rna ba g-yon par mi thung ma //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon par mi thung ma //
translated: The short one is in the left ear.

original: chu rgyus 'bab par gyur ba yin //
analyzed: chu rgyus 'bab par gyur ba yin //
translated: It causes the ligaments to flow.

original: smin ma'i dbus gnas rus sbal skyes //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus gnas rus sbal skyes //
translated: The tortoise is in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: rus pa nges par 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: rus pa nges par 'bab pa yin //
translated: It causes the bones to flow.

original: sgom pa ma ni mig la gnas //
analyzed: sgom pa ma ni mig la gnas //
translated: The meditation channel is in the eyes.

original: rtag tu snying 'khrung 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu snying 'khrung 'bab pa yin //
translated: It causes the heart to always be full.

original: dbang po lag pa'i dpung par gnas //
analyzed: dbang po lag pa'i dpung par gnas //
translated: The one called Indrani is located in the arm of the right hand.🔽The one called Hridaya is located in the heart.

original: snying ni 'bab par 'dod pa yin //🔽skyon ma brang gi gnas su song //
analyzed: snying ni 'bab par 'dod pa yin // skyon ma brang gi gnas su song //
translated: The one called Dosha is located in the chest.

original: mig 'bab pa yi rtsa yin no //
analyzed: mig 'bab pa yi rtsa yin no //
translated: The one called Netra is located in the eye.

original: 'jug ma nu mar yang dag gnas //🔽mkhris pas nges par gang nas 'bab //
analyzed: 'jug ma nu mar yang dag gnas // mkhris pas nges par gang nas 'bab //
translated: The one called Anuja is located in the breast.🔽The one called Pitta is located in the stomach.

original: ma mo lte ba'i phyogs na gnas //
analyzed: ma mo lte ba'i phyogs na gnas //
translated: The one called Mama is located in the navel.

original: mchin pa 'bab pa rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mchin pa 'bab pa rab tu 'gyur //
translated: The one called Yakshini is located in the liver.🔽The one called Raktini is located in the nose.

original: mtshan mo sna yi rtse mor gnas //🔽rgyu ma'i phreng ba nges par 'bab //
analyzed: mtshan mo sna yi rtse mor gnas // rgyu ma'i phreng ba nges par 'bab //
translated: The one called Antra is located in the intestines.

original: bsil sbyin ma ni kha na gnas //🔽rtsib ma'i logs kyi rtsa bran 'bab //🔽tsha ba ma ni mgrin par gnas //
analyzed: bsil sbyin ma ni kha na gnas // rtsib ma'i logs kyi rtsa bran 'bab // tsha ba ma ni mgrin par gnas //
translated: The one called Sitavati is located in the mouth.🔽The one called Parva is located in the ribs.🔽The one called Ushtra is located in the throat.

original: grod pa 'bab par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: grod pa 'bab par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The one called Amashhaya is located in the stomach.

original: tshad ma snying gi kha na gnas //🔽dri chen rtag tu 'bab par 'gyur //🔽kha dog nag mo mtshan mar gnas //
analyzed: tshad ma snying gi kha na gnas // dri chen rtag tu 'bab par 'gyur // kha dog nag mo mtshan mar gnas //
translated: The one called Prameha is located in the heart.🔽The one called Krishna is located in the genitals.🔽The one called Marichi is located in the head.

original: rtsa de mtshog srubs nang du gnas //🔽sra zhing brtan pa'i gzugs kyis gnas //
analyzed: rtsa de mtshog srubs nang du gnas // sra zhing brtan pa'i gzugs kyis gnas //
translated: The one called Kshura is located in the skull.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.

original: sems can kun la bde ba ster //
analyzed: sems can kun la bde ba ster //
translated: The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.🔽The one called Sarva is located in the body.

original: spyi ma gsang ba'i gnas na gnas //
analyzed: spyi ma gsang ba'i gnas na gnas //
translated: The general one abides in the secret place.

original: rtag tu rnag ni 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu rnag ni 'bab pa yin //
translated: It always flows with pus.

original: brla yi gnas na yod pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: brla yi gnas na yod pa'i rtsa //
translated: The nāḍī that exists in the place of the thighs

original: de ni rgyu sbyin ma yin te //🔽byin @16a * //🔽par gnas na khrag 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu sbyin ma yin te // byin @16a * // par gnas na khrag 'bab pa'o //
translated: is the one called “giver of causes.”🔽It flows with blood in the place of the vulva.

original: sbyor bral ma ni rdul 'bab po //
analyzed: sbyor bral ma ni rdul 'bab po //
translated: The one called “free of union” flows with semen.

original: brtse ba ma ni sor mor gnas //
analyzed: brtse ba ma ni sor mor gnas //
translated: The one called “loving” is in the fingers.

original: sna tshogs pa yi khu ba 'bab //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa yi khu ba 'bab //
translated: It flows with various essences.

original: grub ma rkang pa'i bol na gnas //
analyzed: grub ma rkang pa'i bol na gnas //
translated: The one called “accomplished” is in the ball of the foot.

original: rnam pa kun du mchi ma 'bab //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du mchi ma 'bab //
translated: It always flows with tears.

original: 'tshed ma mthe bo'i gnas na yod //
analyzed: 'tshed ma mthe bo'i gnas na yod //
translated: The one called “cook” is in the big toe.

original: thams cad du ni mchil ma 'bab //
analyzed: thams cad du ni mchil ma 'bab //
translated: It always flows with saliva.

original: bzhin bzang pus mo'i lha ngar gnas //
analyzed: bzhin bzang pus mo'i lha ngar gnas //
translated: The one called “beautiful face” is in the kneecaps.

original: stobs dang snabs ni 'bab pa yin //
analyzed: stobs dang snabs ni 'bab pa yin //
translated: It flows with strength and mucus.

original: sum skor ma ni mdoms na gnas //
analyzed: sum skor ma ni mdoms na gnas //
translated: The one called “triplex” is in the genitals.

original: mtshog ma'i srubs ni 'bab par 'dod //
analyzed: mtshog ma'i srubs ni 'bab par 'dod //
translated: It is asserted that it flows in the channel of the uvula.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa 'di rnams //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa 'di rnams //
translated: These twenty-four nāḍīs

original: gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bar 'dod //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bar 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the divisions of the places, and so on.

original: 'dod pa can dang he ga dang / gtum mo 'dod pa bu mo dang // lnga po snying gi dkyil gnas nas //
analyzed: 'dod pa can dang he ga dang / gtum mo 'dod pa bu mo dang // lnga po snying gi dkyil gnas nas //
translated: The five—the passionate one, the one with the penis, the passionate one, the girl, and the fifth—are in the middle of the heart.

original: rtsa ni lnga nas bdud rtsi 'bab //
analyzed: rtsa ni lnga nas bdud rtsi 'bab //
translated: The channels are five, from which the nectars flow.

original: 'di ni kha sbyor rgyud sogs kyi //
analyzed: 'di ni kha sbyor rgyud sogs kyi //
translated: This is the meaning of the Connected Tantra and so forth.

original: don ni blangs nas rtsa gnas pa'i //
analyzed: don ni blangs nas rtsa gnas pa'i //
translated: Having taken up the meaning,

original: byed pa nges par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: byed pa nges par bstan pa yin //
translated: the channels are taught to be the agents.

original: rtsa gsum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams kyang ji lta bu yin pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: rtsa gsum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams kyang ji lta bu yin pa gsungs pa ;
translated: The thirty-two channels are also described:

original: / srid gsum yongs su gyur thams cad ni //
analyzed: / srid gsum yongs su gyur thams cad ni //
translated: All the three worlds are transformed,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: free from the duality of object and subject.

original: yang na thabs ni thams cad kyis //
analyzed: yang na thabs ni thams cad kyis //
translated: Or else, by all the methods,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag //
translated: the characteristics of things are imagined.

original: ces pa smos so //
analyzed: ces pa smos so //
translated: This is stated.

original: gsum gyi sgras sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
analyzed: gsum gyi sgras sku dang gsung dang thugs so //
translated: The word “three” refers to body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di gsum ni srid par gyur pas srid pa gsum ste //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni srid par gyur pas srid pa gsum ste //
translated: These three are the three worlds, since they are the transformation of existence.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the form realm, formless realm, and so forth.

original: de yongs su gyur pa ni rgyu mthun pa ste //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa ni rgyu mthun pa ste //
translated: Their transformation is the natural outflow.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyis srid gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid de srid pa gsum rgyu mthun pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni de'i bdag nyid kyis srid gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid de srid pa gsum rgyu mthun pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That which has that is the nature of the transformation of the three worlds, since the three worlds are the nature of the natural outflow.

original: thams cad ces pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni /
translated: “All” refers to

original: lhag ma med / de bas na gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: lhag ma med / de bas na gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs te /
translated: Since there is no remainder, therefore, having abandoned the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: gzung ba ni 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gzung ba ni 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin zhing /
translated: the apprehended is dependent on the apprehender,

original: 'dzin pa yang gzung ba la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang gzung ba la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: and the apprehender is also dependent on the apprehended. Therefore, the apprehended and the apprehender are not observed,

original: de'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir spangs pa'o //
translated: because their object does not exist.

original: yang na zhes pa ni bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa ni bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
translated: “Or” indicates the teaching of the summary.

original: thabs ni thams cad kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thabs ni thams cad kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: “By all means” is

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi thabs phyag dang zhal dang mdog dang dbyibs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi thabs phyag dang zhal dang mdog dang dbyibs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: the method, which has the nature of the dharmadhātu, characterized by the entities of hands, faces, color, and shape.

original: de nyid rtag pa ste rtsa'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rtag pa ste rtsa'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the constant, which is said to be the nature of the nāḍīs.

original: yang na thabs ni thams cad kyis ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //🔽dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag //
analyzed: yang na thabs ni thams cad kyis ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so // dngos po'i mtshan nyid du ni brtag //
translated: Or, the method is by all means, which is the nature of Vajradhara.

original: ces pa ni gang gis @16b gzhig pa de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni gang gis @16b gzhig pa de ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ste /
translated: “The characteristics of entities are imagined” means that that which is imagined is the characteristic of entities.

original: srid gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: srid gsum yongs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: Because the three existences are completely transformed.

original: 'di ni zung 'jug rgyun gyi rim pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zung 'jug rgyun gyi rim pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the process of continuity of union.

original: de nas sdom pa'i dbye ba yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdom pa'i dbye ba yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, the division of the summary should be explained.

original: sdom pa ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Summary is the collection.

original: dbye ba ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: dbye ba ni spro ba'o //
translated: Division is the expansion.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba tha mi dad pas gang dag ma ning du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba tha mi dad pas gang dag ma ning du gyur pa'o //
translated: Expansion and collection are not different.

original: de bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: That is to be explained.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i mchog gtso bo dbye ba'i khyad par gong ma'i yang gong ma'i khyad par bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i mchog gtso bo dbye ba'i khyad par gong ma'i yang gong ma'i khyad par bshad par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, the division of the supreme, true, and principal should be explained as the difference of the higher and higher.

original: yang na sdom pas sdom pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sdom pas sdom pa ste kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, the summary is the summary by the summary, which is the conventional truth.

original: de'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni /
translated: Its division is

original: gzhan ma yin zhing skabs sna tshogs pa yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhing skabs sna tshogs pa yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: not other and is just the various topics.

original: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To be explained means

original: mtshan mar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar byas pa yin no //
translated: that it is made into a sign.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated.

original: a'a li k'a li ni zhes pa ste /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li ni zhes pa ste /
translated: The ālikāli is said to be🔽the supreme, true, and principal.

original: a'a li ni aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
analyzed: a'a li ni aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
translated: The vowels are the sixteen vowels beginning with “a. ”

original: k'a li ni yi ge ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed rnams so //
analyzed: k'a li ni yi ge ka la sogs pa'i gsal byed rnams so //
translated: The consonants are the consonants beginning with “ka. ”

original: gnyi ga yang thabs dang shes rab ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang thabs dang shes rab ste /
translated: Both are method and wisdom.

original: shes rab ni bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Wisdom is the mandala of Nairātmya.

original: thabs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Method is

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the mandala of Vajradhara.🔽Dharma, enjoyment, and emanation are body, speech, and mind.

original: chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs so zhes pa ni sprul pa ni sku'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa ni sku dang gsung dang / thugs so zhes pa ni sprul pa ni sku'o //
translated: Emanation is body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni gsung ngo //🔽chos ni thugs te go bzlog pas go bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni gsung ngo // chos ni thugs te go bzlog pas go bar bya'o //
translated: Enjoyment is speech.🔽Dharma is mind.

original: ae wam ma y'a'i //
analyzed: ae wam ma y'a'i //
translated: The order should be understood to be reversed.

original: ae yi rnam pa lha mo spyan //
analyzed: ae yi rnam pa lha mo spyan //
translated: E is the goddess Locanā.

original: wam gyi yi ge bdag mar brjod //
analyzed: wam gyi yi ge bdag mar brjod //
translated: Vaṃ is said to be Māmakī.

original: ma ni lha mo gos dkar mo //🔽y'a yi rnam pa sgrol mar brjod //
analyzed: ma ni lha mo gos dkar mo // y'a yi rnam pa sgrol mar brjod //
translated: Ma is the goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī.🔽Ya is said to be Tārā.

original: sa ni spyan mar bshad pa nyid //
analyzed: sa ni spyan mar bshad pa nyid //
translated: Sa is explained to be Locanā.

original: chu khams m'a ma k'i ru bshad //
analyzed: chu khams m'a ma k'i ru bshad //
translated: The water element is explained to be Māmakī.

original: me ni lha mo gos dkar mo //
analyzed: me ni lha mo gos dkar mo //
translated: Fire is the goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags //
translated: Wind is well known to be Tārā.

original: zhes bya bas gsang sngags kyi tshul 'dir a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi rim pa las thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis ni sku gsum skyed ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gsang sngags kyi tshul 'dir a'a li k'a li gnyis kyi rim pa las thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis ni sku gsum skyed ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way of mantra, the three bodies are generated by the nature of method and wisdom, from the stages of the two, ālikāli.

original: de nyid sku gsung thugs 'byung ba bzhi rab tu gnas pa de nyid spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo 'khor lo'i rim par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid sku gsung thugs 'byung ba bzhi rab tu gnas pa de nyid spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo 'khor lo'i rim par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: That very [nature] is the origin of body, speech, and mind, the four great [elements], and that very [nature] is the goddesses Locanā and so forth, abiding in the stages of the wheels.

original: 'khor lo bzhi po de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi po de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The four wheels themselves are stated:

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo la 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chos kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad dang / longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo la 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chos kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma brgyad dang / longs spyod kyi 'khor lo 'dab ma bcu drug dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis so zhes pa ste /
translated: The nirmāṇacakra has sixty-four petals, the dharmacākra has eight petals, the saṃbhogacakra has sixteen petals, and the mahāsukhacakra has thirty-two petals.

original: @17a * // 'khor lo'i grangs kyi rim pas rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: @17a * // 'khor lo'i grangs kyi rim pas rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are arranged in the sequence of the number of wheels.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang zhes par smos te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang zhes par smos te /
translated: The nirmāṇacakra has sixty-four petals.

original: sprul pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sprul pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Nirmāṇa has the characteristic of appearance.

original: 'khor lo ni sems so //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni sems so //
translated: The wheel is the mind.

original: 'dab ma ni n'a da'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma ni n'a da'o //
translated: The petals are the nāḍīs.

original: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs las 'byung ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la sku dang gsung dang thugs las 'byung ba bzhi'o //
translated: Therein are the four that arise from body, speech, and mind.

original: drug cu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor drug cu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: drug cu zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor drug cu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The sixty are the nature of the sixty maṇḍalas.

original: 'dis ni lte bar ham ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni lte bar ham ngo //
translated: This is the haṃ in the navel.

original: 'dab ma bzhi la ya ra la ba'o //🔽ka la sogs pa lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa lnga bcu dang / sa aapa sha sha aaka aaka sha sha aapa sa rnams lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi la ya ra la ba'o // ka la sogs pa lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa lnga bcu dang / sa aapa sha sha aaka aaka sha sha aapa sa rnams lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The four petals are ya, ra, la, and va.

original: drug bcu rtsa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: drug bcu rtsa bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The fifty of ka and so on, forward and backward, and sa, pa, ṣa, ṣa, a, kṣa, śa, pa, and sa, forward and backward, are the sixty-four.

original: yang na brgyad kyi bar gyis te /
analyzed: yang na brgyad kyi bar gyis te /
translated: Or else, there are eight:

original: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams dang / yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug dang / ka la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
analyzed: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams dang / yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug dang / ka la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams te /
translated: ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and śa, and the sixteen vowels beginning with a, and the thirty-four consonants beginning with ka.

original: cung zad nga ro zhan pa ta dha da dha ya la rnams so //
analyzed: cung zad nga ro zhan pa ta dha da dha ya la rnams so //
translated: The slightly weak ones are ta, dha, da, and dha.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo brgyad ces pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo brgyad ces pa ni /
translated: The eight of the dharmacakra are

original: dkyil 'khor drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams brgyad kyis bsdus pas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams brgyad kyis bsdus pas so //
translated: The sixty-four mandalas are included in the eight.

original: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo la 'dab ma bcu drug ces pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo la 'dab ma bcu drug ces pa ni /
translated: The enjoyment wheel has sixteen petals.

original: dkyil 'khor brgyad po de nyid 'gyur du byas pas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brgyad po de nyid 'gyur du byas pas so //
translated: Those very eight mandalas are doubled.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gsum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gsum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa ni /
translated: The great bliss wheel has thirty-two.

original: bcu drug po de nyid 'gyur du byas pa las so //
analyzed: bcu drug po de nyid 'gyur du byas pa las so //
translated: Those very sixteen are doubled.

original: sku bzhi ni /
analyzed: sku bzhi ni /
translated: The four bodies are

original: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: the emanation body, the dharma body, the enjoyment body, and the essence body.

original: sku bzhi mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: sku bzhi mngon par bstan to //
translated: The four bodies are fully taught.

original: skad cig ma bzhi ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma bzhi ni /
translated: The four moments are

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes pa /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyed pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o zhes pa /
translated: the various, the matured, the diminishing, and the free from characteristics.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba ni yang //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba ni yang //
translated: The following will be explained:

original: sna tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs brjod //
analyzed: sna tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs brjod //
translated: The various is said to be various.

original: 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa //
analyzed: 'khyud dang 'o byed la sogs pa //
translated: Embracing, kissing, and so on

original: rnam par smin pa de las bzlog / bde ba'i ye shes za ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa de las bzlog / bde ba'i ye shes za ba'o //
translated: are the matured, the opposite of that, the enjoyment of the bliss gnosis.

original: 'khyud pa la sogs pa nye bar dga' ba ni //
analyzed: 'khyud pa la sogs pa nye bar dga' ba ni //
translated: The embrace, etc., is the delight.

original: dga' ba dang mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog dga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is of the nature of joy and supreme joy.

original: rnam par nyed pa dpyod par brjod //
analyzed: rnam par nyed pa dpyod par brjod //
translated: The emission is said to be the investigation.

original: bdag gis bde ba spyad do zhes //
analyzed: bdag gis bde ba spyad do zhes //
translated: The thought, I have experienced bliss,🔽is the investigation.

original: 'dis ni rnam par dga' ba'i don bde ba la gcig tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par dga' ba'i don bde ba la gcig tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This has the nature of the bliss which is the object of the emission.

original: mtshan nyid bral ba gsum las gzhan //🔽chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bral ba gsum las gzhan // chags dang chags bral rnam par spangs //
translated: The third is free from the characteristics.🔽It is the abandonment of attachment and non-attachment.

original: @17b 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
analyzed: @17b 'dod chags med cing chags bral med //
translated: It is neither attachment nor non-attachment.

original: dbu ma dmigs par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: dbu ma dmigs par mi 'gyur te //
translated: The middle is not perceived.

original: gsum po spangs par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: gsum po spangs par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: It is the abandonment of the three.

original: de nyid lhan cig skyes par brjod //
analyzed: de nyid lhan cig skyes par brjod //
translated: It is called innate.

original: ces bya ba'i don gyi tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don gyi tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'di yang skad cig ma bzhi dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa rim par sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: 'di yang skad cig ma bzhi dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa rim par sbyar ba ni /
translated: This is also applied to the four moments and the emanation wheel, etc.,

original: rim par rnam par bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rim par rnam par bzhag pa'o //
translated: in the sequential presentation.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four noble truths are

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni shes par bya'o //
translated: Suffering is to be known.

original: kun 'byung ni spang par bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni spang par bya ba'o //
translated: The origin of suffering is to be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //🔽lam ni bsgom gyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'o // lam ni bsgom gyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Cessation is to be manifested.🔽The path is to be cultivated.

original: de nas dge ba la sogs pa kun 'byung spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas dge ba la sogs pa kun 'byung spangs pa'o //
translated: Then, having fully known suffering, the origin of virtue and so on is abandoned.

original: de nas 'gog pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, cessation is

original: rnam par rtog pa bcu spangs nas log pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bcu spangs nas log pa'o //
translated: reversed, having abandoned the ten conceptualizations.

original: de nas lam bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de nas lam bsgom pa ni /
translated: Then, the cultivation of the path

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam 'dris shing byang ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam 'dris shing byang ba las byung ba'o //
translated: arises from the path of perfect complete enlightenment, having become familiar and purified.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo bzhi la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo bzhi la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The four wheels should be applied in the same way.

original: de kho na nyid bzhi ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi ni /
translated: The four realities are

original: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality of the self, the reality of mantra, the reality of the deity, and the reality of gnosis.

original: de ltar rim pa sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the sequence is applied.

original: dga' ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi ni /
translated: The four joys are

original: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / rnam par dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / rnam par dga' ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: joy, supreme joy, special joy, and innate joy.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: It will also be explained:

original: dga' ba bde ba cung zad de //
analyzed: dga' ba bde ba cung zad de //
translated: Joy is a slight bliss.

original: mchog tu dga' ba de bas lhag / rnam par dga' ba chags par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba de bas lhag / rnam par dga' ba chags par 'gyur //
translated: Supreme joy is greater than that. Special joy is the passion.

original: lhan cig skyes dga' lhag ma nyid //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' lhag ma nyid //
translated: Innate joy is the remainder.

original: ces pa'o // sde pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: ces pa'o // sde pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four orders are:

original: gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mang pos bkur ba dang / dge 'dun phal chen no //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mang pos bkur ba dang / dge 'dun phal chen no //
translated: the Sthavira, Sarvāstivāda, Mahāsāṃghika, and Saṃmatīya.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /🔽gang phyir sprul par gnas brtan phyir //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang / gang phyir sprul par gnas brtan phyir //
translated: It will also be explained:🔽Because of the emanation, the Sthavira.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas brtan nyid //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas brtan nyid //
translated: Because of the emanation wheel, the Sthavira.

original: chos ni smra ba las phyung phyir //
analyzed: chos ni smra ba las phyung phyir //
translated: Because of the extraction of the teaching,

original: chos kyi 'khor lor thams cad yod /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lor thams cad yod /
translated: the Sarvāstivāda.

original: gang phyir mgrin par myong ba'i phyir //🔽longs spyod 'khor lo mang pos bskur //🔽gang phyir bde chen 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: gang phyir mgrin par myong ba'i phyir // longs spyod 'khor lo mang pos bskur // gang phyir bde chen 'khor lor gnas //
translated: Because of the experience at the throat,🔽the Mahāsāṃghika.🔽Because of the abiding in the great bliss wheel,

original: dge 'dun phal chen bde chen du'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen bde chen du'o //
translated: the Mahāsāṃghika.

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar thams cad do //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar thams cad do //
translated: Thus, everything.

original: zla ba nyi ma zhes pa la /
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma zhes pa la /
translated: The moon and the sun,

original: zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: the moon is the bodhicitta.

original: nyi ma zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyi ma zhes pa ni /
translated: The sun is

original: sihla ka ste /
analyzed: sihla ka ste /
translated: siṃhala.

original: @18a * // 'di gnyis so //🔽a'a li dang k'a li'i /
analyzed: @18a * // 'di gnyis so // a'a li dang k'a li'i /
translated: These two.🔽The vowels and the consonants,

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs dang / yi ge ka la sogs pa gsal byed do //
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs dang / yi ge ka la sogs pa gsal byed do //
translated: the vowels are the letters a and so forth, and the consonants are the letters ka and so forth.

original: 'pho ba bcu drug dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu drug dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The sixteen movements,

original: nyin zhag gcig la thun brgyad rnams kyis thun phyed phyed na 'pho'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la thun brgyad rnams kyis thun phyed phyed na 'pho'o //
translated: in one day, the movements are in the eight periods, in each half period.

original: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The sixty-four breaths,

original: 'pho ba bcu drug la re re zhing 'dir skad cig bzhi'i bye brag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu drug la re re zhing 'dir skad cig bzhi'i bye brag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: in each of the sixteen movements, it should be understood that there are four moments.

original: chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The thirty-two nāḍīs,

original: 'pho ba bcu drug la thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas 'pho ba gnyis kyi bye brag las go bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu drug la thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas 'pho ba gnyis kyi bye brag las go bar bya'o //
translated: in each of the sixteen movements, it should be understood that there are two nāḍīs, due to the division of method and wisdom.

original: thun tshod bzhi ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thun tshod bzhi ste zhes pa ni /
translated: The four periods,

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag la yang yin te /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag la yang yin te /
translated: in the day and in the night,

original: de ni thun brgyad do //
analyzed: de ni thun brgyad do //
translated: That is the eight periods.

original: rnal 'byor ma re re zhing yang brgyad brgyad kyi khyad par gyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma re re zhing yang brgyad brgyad kyi khyad par gyis te /
translated: And each yoginī has eight distinctions.

original: 'di thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa las dgu'i bdag nyid kyis dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma tha mi dad pa las dgu'i bdag nyid kyis dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: All of this is the maṇḍala of the nature of the nine by way of the indivisibility of Vajradhara and Nairātmya.

original: yang na thun tshod bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na thun tshod bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, the four periods are🔽the sixteen moments of the sixteen movements purified by the sixteen emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'i 'pho ba bcu drug la skad cig ma re re'i nang du thim pa des na dga' ba la sogs pa'i skad cig bzhis thun tshod bzhi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug rnam par dag pa'i 'pho ba bcu drug la skad cig ma re re'i nang du thim pa des na dga' ba la sogs pa'i skad cig bzhis thun tshod bzhi'o //
translated: Since they dissolve into each other, the four periods are the four moments of joy, and so on.

original: kun gyi bdag nyid rab tu gsal bas thams cad nyid sdud par byed pas na thun tshod do //
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid rab tu gsal bas thams cad nyid sdud par byed pas na thun tshod do //
translated: Since the nature of all is clearly manifest, it is a period because it gathers everything.

original: 'dis ni a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas thun tshod bzhi'o zhes pa'i bar gyis /
analyzed: 'dis ni a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas thun tshod bzhi'o zhes pa'i bar gyis /
translated: This explains from “the ālikāli” up to “the four periods”

original: thams cad nyid gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi ye shes dgyes pa'i rdo rje las gsungs pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad nyid gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi ye shes dgyes pa'i rdo rje las gsungs pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: the statement of the wisdom of the entire secret mantra system in Hevajra.

original: 'di ltar a'a li k'a li dag 'pho ba bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar a'a li k'a li dag 'pho ba bcu drug yin te /
translated: Thus, the vowels and consonants are the sixteen movements.

original: aa ai au ka tsa ta ta pa dang ya ra la wa dang / sha sha sa rnams dang / gzhom du med pa'i yi ge ha'o //
analyzed: aa ai au ka tsa ta ta pa dang ya ra la wa dang / sha sha sa rnams dang / gzhom du med pa'i yi ge ha'o //
translated: A, i, u, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, ra, la, va, śa, ṣa, sa, and the invincible syllable ha.

original: de ltar bcu drug tu bzhag pa gang 'pho ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bcu drug tu bzhag pa gang 'pho ba yin no //
translated: These are the sixteen movements.

original: de nyid dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de nyid dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi ste /
translated: They are also the sixty-four moras.

original: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams dang / yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug dang ka la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / cung zad nga ro zhan pa da dha da dha ya la rnams so //
analyzed: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams dang / yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug dang ka la sogs pa gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / cung zad nga ro zhan pa da dha da dha ya la rnams so //
translated: The a, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and śa, the sixteen vowels beginning with a, the thirty-four consonants beginning with ka, and the five slightly weak-sounding da, dha, da, dha, and ba.

original: de ltar drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, there are sixty-four.

original: chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang // zhes pa ni dbyangs bcu drug nyis 'gyur dang / ka la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga dang / ya ra la wa dang / sha sha sa rnams dang / mi shigs pa 'pho ba rnams yin @18b pas gnyi ga'i khyad par gyis thun tshod bzhi'o //
analyzed: chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang // zhes pa ni dbyangs bcu drug nyis 'gyur dang / ka la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga dang / ya ra la wa dang / sha sha sa rnams dang / mi shigs pa 'pho ba rnams yin @18b pas gnyi ga'i khyad par gyis thun tshod bzhi'o //
translated: and the indestructible transmigrations, are the four periods by the distinction of both.

original: nyin zhag gcig la brgyad de aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams so //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la brgyad de aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha rnams so //
translated: In one day and night, there are eight, namely, a, ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, ya, and śa.

original: bzhi'o zhes pa ni ya ra la wa ste de ltar thams cad do //
analyzed: bzhi'o zhes pa ni ya ra la wa ste de ltar thams cad do //
translated: Four is ya, ra, la, and va. Thus, all.

original: de ltar na de ltar thams cad bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ltar thams cad bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, all are four.

original: zhes pa ni ae wam gi yi ges rgyas btab pas thams cad nyid 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ae wam gi yi ges rgyas btab pas thams cad nyid 'byung ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the seal of the syllable evaṃ. All are the nature of the four elements, the aggregates, constituents, sense-spheres, and so on.

original: bzhi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi zhes pa ni /
translated: Four is

original: dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i mthar yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i mthar yin no //
translated: the end of the connate joy and so on.🔽Now,

original: da ni / ye shes chen po lus la gnas //
analyzed: da ni / ye shes chen po lus la gnas //
translated: great wisdom resides in the body.

original: yang dag rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: yang dag rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: And all correct thoughts are abandoned.🔽

original: dngos po kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: and is the universal pervasion of all things.

original: lus gnas lus la skyes pa min //
analyzed: lus gnas lus la skyes pa min //
translated: It is not located in the body, nor is it born from the body.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'i ye shes chen po de nyid ji ltar rnyed par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'i ye shes chen po de nyid ji ltar rnyed par 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The great wisdom that is stated here is said to be attained in the following way:

original: lte ba ra gtum po 'bar ba yis //
analyzed: lte ba ra gtum po 'bar ba yis //
translated: The blazing of the fire of Caṇḍālī

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
translated: burns the five transcendent lords,

original: spyan ma la sogs yang bsregs pas //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs yang bsregs pas //
translated: and also burns Locanā and so forth.

original: bsregs pas ri bong can ham 'dzag /🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsregs pas ri bong can ham 'dzag / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The melting of the rabbit-holder is due to the burning.

original: gtum mo 'bar nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtum mo 'bar nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The blazing of the fire of Caṇḍālī

original: bsrub par bya ba dang / srub par byed pa'i sbyor bas ye shes kyi mi'o //
analyzed: bsrub par bya ba dang / srub par byed pa'i sbyor bas ye shes kyi mi'o //
translated: is the wisdom being, who is the object of copulation, and the method being, who is the copulator, in union.

original: 'bar ba ni rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni rab tu gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The blazing is the clear appearance of the two.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo ro //
analyzed: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo ro //
translated: In the navel, the wheel of emanation.🔽What does it do?

original: ci byed ce na bsregs pa'o //
analyzed: ci byed ce na bsregs pa'o //
translated: It burns.

original: ci zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ci zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa lnga ste /
translated: What is it?

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lor son pa rnams lu la las ldog par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa chos kyi 'khor lor son pa rnams lu la las ldog par byed do //
translated: The five transcendent lords, who are located in the wheel of phenomena, the aggregate of form, and so forth.

original: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs ni spyan la sogs pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gzung bar 'dod pa de yang dbang po las ldog par byed cing bsregs pa'i dbang po dang yul dag dbang po las ldog cing /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs ni spyan la sogs pa'i sgras gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gzung bar 'dod pa de yang dbang po las ldog par byed cing bsregs pa'i dbang po dang yul dag dbang po las ldog cing /
translated: If the eyes and so on are burned, the objects of form and so on that are held to be apprehended by the eyes and so on are also turned away from the sense faculties and burned.🔽

original: yul dang dbang po dag kyang dbang po yul las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dag kyang dbang po yul las ldog pa'o //
translated: Having burned the eyes and so forth, the eyes and so forth are the objects such as form that are intended to be grasped. Those are also turned away from the sense organ. The sense organ and the object are turned away from the sense organ. The object and the sense organ are turned away from the sense organ and the object.

original: ham 'dzag pa ni /
analyzed: ham 'dzag pa ni /
translated: The dripping of the haṃ

original: yi ge ham zhu pa'i rnam par gyur to //
analyzed: yi ge ham zhu pa'i rnam par gyur to //
translated: is the transformation into the form of the melting syllable haṃ.

original: de yang ji lta bu gzugs yin pas gsungs pa /🔽ri bong can zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu gzugs yin pas gsungs pa / ri bong can zhes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be what kind of form?

original: byang chub kyi sems zla ba bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin mngon par gsal bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zla ba bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin mngon par gsal bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The “rabbit” is the bodhicitta, which is the arising of the clear appearance of Vajradhara, inseparable from the moon Nairātmya.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the literal explanation.

original: yang na gtum mo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: yang na gtum mo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: Alternatively, the term “caṇḍālī”

original: gtum pa ni nyi ma ste shes rab po /
analyzed: gtum pa ni nyi ma ste shes rab po /
translated: is the sun, which is wisdom.

original: aa ni zla ba ste thabs so //
analyzed: aa ni zla ba ste thabs so //
translated: A is the moon, which is method.

original: gnyi ga yang yi ge aam dang ham du so sor @19a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang yi ge aam dang ham du so sor @19a * //
translated: Both of those are individually the syllables haṃ and ha.

original: bsdus shing lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid kyis lus kyi n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i sngags lha'i sku'i tshul can de ni gtum mo 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus shing lugs dang lugs las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid kyis lus kyi n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i sngags lha'i sku'i tshul can de ni gtum mo 'bar ba ste /
