translated: The blazing of the fierce fire is the form of the mantra deity, the mantra body, which is the nature of the two garlands of nāḍīs of the body, in the sense of being neither different nor not different.

original: des cha med pa 'od gsal du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des cha med pa 'od gsal du gyur pa'o //
translated: By that, the partless [body] becomes clear light.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: lte bar te /
analyzed: lte bar te /
translated: At the navel.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin sngar bstan pa'i n'a da drug cu rtsa bzhis bsdus par gyur pa'i khu ba'i rnam pa /🔽aam ham ham aam /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin sngar bstan pa'i n'a da drug cu rtsa bzhis bsdus par gyur pa'i khu ba'i rnam pa / aam ham ham aam /
translated: The nature of the emanation wheel is the essence of the sixty-four petals, which is the nature of the previously explained sixty-four nāḍīs.

original: lus khu ba'i rnam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'o //
analyzed: lus khu ba'i rnam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'o //
translated: The form of the bodhicitta, the moon, is the form of the semen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing //
translated: The five tathāgatas are burned.

original: zhes pa ni ka'i sde tshan la sogs pa'i sde tshan lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ka'i sde tshan la sogs pa'i sde tshan lnga'o //
translated: The five groups are the group of ka and so on.

original: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa ni ya ra la wa rnams so //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa ni ya ra la wa rnams so //
translated: The burning of Locanā and so on is ya, ra, la, and va.

original: dang po'i mang po'i tshig gis sku gsum gyi rang bzhin sha sha sa dang / aa zhes bya ba yi ge aa la sogs pa aam gyi mthar mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin n'a da bcom lngas so sor bsdus pa'i dbyangs bco lnga de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //🔽da dha da dha ya la ni /
analyzed: dang po'i mang po'i tshig gis sku gsum gyi rang bzhin sha sha sa dang / aa zhes bya ba yi ge aa la sogs pa aam gyi mthar mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin n'a da bcom lngas so sor bsdus pa'i dbyangs bco lnga de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid kyis so // da dha da dha ya la ni /
translated: The vowels and consonants are the nature of the fifteen nāḍīs.

original: gsal byed drug gi gzugs byang chub kyi sems drug gi yi ge rnams dang / n'a da gnyis ka yang bsdus par gyur pa'i aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha /
analyzed: gsal byed drug gi gzugs byang chub kyi sems drug gi yi ge rnams dang / n'a da gnyis ka yang bsdus par gyur pa'i aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha /
translated: The six consonants, da, dha, da, dha, ya, and la, are the forms of the six bodhicitta syllables, and the two nāḍīs, the lalanā and rasanā, are included in both.🔽The eight vowels and consonants are the eight nāḍīs, a, ā, ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa, and ṅa.🔽The two nāḍīs of the perfect aggregate are a, ā, ka, kha, ga, gha, ṅa, and ṅa.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi n'a da brgyad dang / a'a aaka aaka aapa ni yang dag pa'i gong bu'i n'a da gnyis dang / yi ge ksha bsdus pa yi ge ham dang aam gang yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi n'a da brgyad dang / a'a aaka aaka aapa ni yang dag pa'i gong bu'i n'a da gnyis dang / yi ge ksha bsdus pa yi ge ham dang aam gang yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The syllable haṃ and aṃ are the transformation of the syllable kṣa.

original: de de'i tshe bsregs pa ni /
analyzed: de de'i tshe bsregs pa ni /
translated: At that time, the burning

original: yam shing med pa'i me'i rang bzhin nyid du snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yam shing med pa'i me'i rang bzhin nyid du snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: is the samādhi of the nature of fire without fuel.

original: ri bong can ham 'dzag ces pa ni /
analyzed: ri bong can ham 'dzag ces pa ni /
translated: The hare-marked moon drips,

original: byang chub sems zla ba bskus pa'i bdag nyid byung nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems zla ba bskus pa'i bdag nyid byung nas /
translated: which is the nature of the bodhicitta moon.

original: zag pas lus thams cad kyi mtshan mo thams cad chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi bdag nyid byung ba yin te /
analyzed: zag pas lus thams cad kyi mtshan mo thams cad chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi bdag nyid byung ba yin te /
translated: The dripping is the nature of the eighty-four thousand aggregates of dharma that arise in the body of all sentient beings at night.

original: rim pa 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' bas bla ma dam pa'i man ngag gis gzhan las shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rim pa 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' bas bla ma dam pa'i man ngag gis gzhan las shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: This stage is very difficult to attain, and so it should be known from another [source] through the intimate instructions of a holy guru.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i rim pa ste sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa cha med pa'i phyir de nyid yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i rim pa ste sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa cha med pa'i phyir de nyid yin par dgongs so //
translated: The stage with remainder is not literal, and it is intended that it is just that because it is incomplete.

original: yang na / lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yig //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang na / lte bar gtum mo sbar ba yig // zhes pa ni /
translated: The fire is ignited at the navel.🔽The fire is the forty nāḍī syllables of the garland of nāḍīs in the manner of the kṣa.

original: gtum pa de nyid kash'a li'i tshul gyis n'a da'i phreng ba cung zad nga ro zhan pa da dha da dha yal dang bcas pa'i n'a da bzhi bcu @19b tham pa'o /
analyzed: gtum pa de nyid kash'a li'i tshul gyis n'a da'i phreng ba cung zad nga ro zhan pa da dha da dha yal dang bcas pa'i n'a da bzhi bcu @19b tham pa'o /
translated: The syllables are slightly faint, and they are accompanied by the dha and dha.

original: a'a l'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: a'a l'i zhes pa ni /
translated: The āli is

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug rnams so //
translated: the sixteen vowels, such as a.

original: 'di gnyis dang gsal byed kyi rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang gsal byed kyi rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyis skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi rnam par dag pa dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub pa'i rnam par dag pa'i sku'o //
translated: By the nature of these two, vowels and consonants, which are the essence of method and wisdom, the body is purified as the nature of the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks, and the body is purified as the manifest enlightenment of omniscience.

original: de ltar dbyangs dang gsal byed dag brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi nad las bla ba'i man ngag gis nye bar 'dus nas sprul pa'i 'khor lor nyi zla'i nang du phreng ba'i tshul gyis rnam par bkod nas kha sbyar ba'i nang du gnyi ga'i bu gar ye shes kyis
analyzed: de ltar dbyangs dang gsal byed dag brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi nad las bla ba'i man ngag gis nye bar 'dus nas sprul pa'i 'khor lor nyi zla'i nang du phreng ba'i tshul gyis rnam par bkod nas kha sbyar ba'i nang du gnyi ga'i bu gar ye shes kyis
translated: Thus, by the intimate instruction of extracting the vowels and consonants from the one hundred and twelve, they are gathered into the emanation wheel, arranged in the manner of a garland inside the sun and moon, and the two are united.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas las kyi rlung gis bskul bas gtum mo 'bar te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas las kyi rlung gis bskul bas gtum mo 'bar te /
translated: The two are blessed by the gnosis of the two, and since they are impelled by the karmavāyu, caṇḍālī blazes.

original: 'bar bas chos kyi 'khor lor song ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsregs nas rang bzhin med par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'bar bas chos kyi 'khor lor song ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bsregs nas rang bzhin med par mdzad do //
translated: Since it blazes, the tathāgatas who have gone to the dharmacakra are incinerated and made nonexistent.

original: 'dus te longs spyod kyi 'khor lor song nas yul drug dang 'khril bas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams bsregs so //
analyzed: 'dus te longs spyod kyi 'khor lor song nas yul drug dang 'khril bas spyan ma la sogs pa rnams bsregs so //
translated: Having gone to the enjoyment wheel, the six objects are embraced, and Locanā and so forth are burned.

original: de nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor song bas ham bsregs so //
analyzed: de nas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor song bas ham bsregs so //
translated: Then, having gone to the great-bliss wheel, the haṃ is burned.

original: bsregs nas rang bzhin med par byas te ri bong can 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: bsregs nas rang bzhin med par byas te ri bong can 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: Having been burned, it is rendered essenceless, and the rabbit drips.

original: rim pa 'di'i rnal 'byor ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'di'i rnal 'byor ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: This yoga of the stages is called the yoga of caṇḍālī.

original: yang na gtum mo ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na gtum mo ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: Alternatively, caṇḍālī is Nairātmya,

original: 'bar ba ni 'od gsal du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni 'od gsal du gyur pa'o //
translated: and blazing is becoming clear light.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: lte ba'i chu byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i tshul la'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i chu byang chub kyi sems khu ba'i tshul la'o //
translated: In the water at the navel, the bodhicitta in the form of semen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs shing ni /
translated: The five tathāgatas are burned,

original: dbang po drug gi rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: that is, the six sense organs.

original: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa ni /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa ni /
translated: Locanā and so forth are burned,

original: yul drug gi tshul rnams so //
analyzed: yul drug gi tshul rnams so //
translated: that is, the six objects.

original: aam bsregs pa drug pa rdo rje 'dzin par gnas te /
analyzed: aam bsregs pa drug pa rdo rje 'dzin par gnas te /
translated: The haṃ is burned, and the sixth, Vajradhara, remains.

original: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lha mo bco lnga rnams bsdus nas /
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul lnga dang rnam par shes pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lha mo bco lnga rnams bsdus nas /
translated: The fifteen goddesses, whose nature is the five sense faculties, the five objects, and the five sense consciousnesses, are gathered.

original: ham gi tshul gyi rdo rje 'dzin 'dzag pa de yang rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ham gi tshul gyi rdo rje 'dzin 'dzag pa de yang rang bzhin med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The vajra holder, who is the nature of the moon, is also transformed into the nature of emptiness.

original: da lta bur gyur pa'i ri bong can byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed pa'i bdag nyid can thams cad spro ba dang bsdu ba'i ngo bo'i rdo rje 'dzin pa 'byung ba yin no //🔽'dir yang ji ltar skyes pa'i ye shes de de bzhin du bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rim pas @20a * //
analyzed: da lta bur gyur pa'i ri bong can byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa dang snying rje dbyer mi phyed pa'i bdag nyid can thams cad spro ba dang bsdu ba'i ngo bo'i rdo rje 'dzin pa 'byung ba yin no // 'dir yang ji ltar skyes pa'i ye shes de de bzhin du bla ma'i gdams ngag gi rim pas @20a * //
translated: The nature of the moon, which is the bodhicitta, is emptiness and compassion, which are inseparable. The vajra holder, whose nature is the moon, is the essence of the emanation and gathering of all of those.

original: shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the wisdom that arises in that way should be understood in that way through the stages of the guru’s instructions.

original: rim pa tsam nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa tsam nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mere stages are taught.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba ste dang po'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba ste dang po'o zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the first chapter of the Vajra Family.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Vajra means indivisible.

original: rigs ni sna tshogs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: rigs ni sna tshogs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Family means the various modes.

original: gnyi ga yang gos dang 'dra bas gos te phan tshun du 'gebs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gos dang 'dra bas gos te phan tshun du 'gebs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Both are like clothing, and so are clothing, because they mutually cover.

original: gzhung 'di'i rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung 'di'i rtsom pa'o //
translated: This is the composition of the text.

original: de len cing 'dzin la rtogs pas rim par phye ba'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin la rtogs pas rim par phye ba'o //
translated: It is divided into sections by the taking up and holding of it, and by the understanding of it.

original: de yang dang po ni /
analyzed: de yang dang po ni /
translated: Moreover, the first is

original: gnyis pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa'o //
translated: the second is not.

original: de yang rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the perfection is

original: mnyam pas gnyis su med pa rnyed pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pas gnyis su med pa rnyed pa thob pa'o //
translated: the attainment of the acquisition of nonduality by means of equality.

original: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter of the commentary on the Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / de ltar sku rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad par bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar sku rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad par bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the vajra body as being inseparable from the three vajras,

original: da ni gsung rdo rje yang rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid du gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gsung rdo rje yang rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid du gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: now the Bhagavān declares that the vajra speech is also the nature of the three vajras.

original: sngags kyi le'u bshad par bya'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: sngags kyi le'u bshad par bya'o zhes smos so //
translated: The chapter on mantra will be explained.

original: sngags kyi sgras ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgras ni /
translated: The word mantra

original: gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: is the vajra speech.

original: de'i yang don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i yang don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: yid skyob par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid skyob par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it protects the mind,

original: sngags zhes mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: sngags zhes mngon par brjod do //
translated: it is called a mantra.

original: yid ni sems yin la de skyob cing skyob pa yin te thugs rdo rje ni rlung la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni sems yin la de skyob cing skyob pa yin te thugs rdo rje ni rlung la zhon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is the thought, and that is the protector, the protector, because the vajra of the mind is mounted on the wind.

original: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus also the Lord has declared:

original: g-yung mo sku la 'khyud nas ni //
analyzed: g-yung mo sku la 'khyud nas ni //
translated: Embracing the Yoginī,

original: 'dod chags chen po rjes chags nyid //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po rjes chags nyid //
translated: the one who is passionate with great passion.

original: zhes pa'o // g-yung mo'i sgras ni rlung du brjod do //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // g-yung mo'i sgras ni rlung du brjod do //
translated: The word Yoginī is said to be wind.

original: de yang na da des kyang lus mtha' dag la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang na da des kyang lus mtha' dag la khyab pa yin no //
translated: And that is the nāḍī, and that pervades the entire body.

original: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa'i sngags de nyid de kho na nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i sgra'i sngags so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer mi phyed pa'i sngags de nyid de kho na nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i sgra'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the indivisibility of the three vajras is the mantra of the sound that impels the meaning of reality.

original: kun bkab te sbas pas gos yin la /
analyzed: kun bkab te sbas pas gos yin la /
translated: It is a garment because it covers and conceals everything.

original: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na sngags kyi rim par phye pa'o //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas na sngags kyi rim par phye pa'o //
translated: It is the division of the stages of the mantra because it takes and holds that.

original: de bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: That should be explained.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i chos kyi phyir sgra ste sgra nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i chos kyi phyir sgra ste sgra nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: It is sound because it is the Dharma of expression, and it is to be understood by sound alone.

original: sgras sgra rtogs pas sgra nyid kyi nang du thim pa yin no //
analyzed: sgras sgra rtogs pas sgra nyid kyi nang du thim pa yin no //
translated: Sound is realized by sound, and so sound dissolves into sound itself.

original: cha med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid n'a da'i bdag nyid can yin te rtogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: cha med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid n'a da'i bdag nyid can yin te rtogs par byed pas so //
translated: The indivisible Vajra Holder is the nature of nāda, because he is the realizer.

original: de la sngags pas bgegs thams cad tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor lo la sogs pa mngon du byas nas dang po kho nar 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la sngags pas bgegs thams cad tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor lo la sogs pa mngon du byas nas dang po kho nar 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: There, the mantra practitioner, in order to destroy all obstacles, having manifested the maṇḍala, and so on, first of all, utters the mantra of the bali offering to all the bhūtas.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba bharm'a n'am a'a d+ya na dpa nn'u tv'a ta /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba bharm'a n'am a'a d+ya na dpa nn'u tv'a ta /
translated: Oṃ akāro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām ādyanutpannatvāt.

original: aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor @20b ma'i sngags so zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor @20b ma'i sngags so zhes pa smos so //
translated: The mantra of the bali offering to all the bhūtas.

original: 'byung po ni srog chags so //
analyzed: 'byung po ni srog chags so //
translated: Bhūtas are living beings.

original: thams cad ces pa ni lhag ma ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni lhag ma ma lus pa'o //
translated: All means without exception.

original: lha la sogs pa 'gro ba rigs drug ste /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa 'gro ba rigs drug ste /
translated: The six classes of beings, such as gods,

original: de rnams kyi gtor ma ni mchod pas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtor ma ni mchod pas tshim par bya'o //
translated: their bali offering is to satisfy them with worship.

original: de'i don gyi sngags so //
analyzed: de'i don gyi sngags so //
translated: The mantra of that meaning.

original: de yang yi ge aa ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang yi ge aa ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: Now, what is the letter A like?

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: It is the door of all dharmas,

original: dang po'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dang po'i rgyu'o //
translated: the first cause.

original: aom zhes pa ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni khas blangs pa'o //
translated: Om is the promise.🔽How?

original: ji ltar zhes na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos kyi rang bzhin ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of dharmas is non-arising, because of primordial non-arising.

original: chos de yang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams aom a'a: h'um gi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de yang rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams aom a'a: h'um gi phyir ro //
translated: And that dharma is the nature of the three vajras, because of Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
translated: Phat, svaha, means

original: phat shes rab bo //
analyzed: phat shes rab bo //
translated: Phat is wisdom,

original: sv'a h'a thabs te /
analyzed: sv'a h'a thabs te /
translated: Svaha is means,

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of means and wisdom.

original: 'dis ni ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid du chos thams cad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid du chos thams cad bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this, all dharmas are taught to be the nature of the five wisdoms and the three bodies.

original: yang na aom zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aom zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or else, Om is the conventional truth,

original: aa k'a ro zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: aa k'a ro zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Aka means the ultimate truth.

original: gnyi gar ni /
analyzed: gnyi gar ni /
translated: In both,

original: sarba dharm'a n'am mu kham ngo //
analyzed: sarba dharm'a n'am mu kham ngo //
translated: all dharmas are the door.

original: gang las she na /🔽a'a dya nudpanna tva ta /
analyzed: gang las she na /🔽a'a dya nudpanna tva ta /
translated: From what?🔽From the beginning, there is no arising.

original: dang por yi ge aom gyi tshul ni /
analyzed: dang por yi ge aom gyi tshul ni /
translated: First, the form of the syllable OM:

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir dang gnyis dbyer med pa'i rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir dang gnyis dbyer med pa'i rtog pa yang de la med pa yin no //
translated: because the conventional truth is unborn, and because of the nature of the ultimate truth, and because the conception of the inseparability of the two does not exist there.

original: de bas na aom a'a: h'um phat gsum yang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na aom a'a: h'um phat gsum yang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the three, OM, AH, and HUM, are also not different.

original: ji ltar tha mi dad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha mi dad ce na /
translated: How are they not different?

original: gang bdag nyid rdo rje gsum gcig pa'i sku sems tsam yin no //
analyzed: gang bdag nyid rdo rje gsum gcig pa'i sku sems tsam yin no //
translated: The body, which is the unity of the three vajras, is mind only.

original: de yang ha rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / aa bdag med pa tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ha rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / aa bdag med pa tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, HA is not different from Vajradhara, and A is not different from Nairatmya.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags ni sems can gyi khams ma lus pa tshim par byed pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pa rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i brda yin no //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags ni sems can gyi khams ma lus pa tshim par byed pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi mchod pa rdo rje'i bdag nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i brda yin no //
translated: The mantra of the bali offering to all spirits is the sign of the invocation of the meaning of the nature of enlightenment, which is the offering that satisfies the entire realm of sentient beings with the nature of a vajra.

original: yang na byas pas ni /
analyzed: yang na byas pas ni /
translated: Or, it is made by the one who is

original: k'a ro ste bya ba yin la de bzhin du 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: k'a ro ste bya ba yin la de bzhin du 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: kara, that is, the agent, and not by the one who is similar in aspect.

original: gang rnams kyi zhe na /
analyzed: gang rnams kyi zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sarba dharm'a n'am zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sarba dharm'a n'am zhes pa'o //
translated: All dharmas.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: a'a dya nudpanna tva ta /
analyzed: a'a dya nudpanna tva ta /
translated: From the state of the three vajras.

original: de'i phyir mu kham ngo ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mu kham ngo ;
translated: Therefore, the end.

original: / yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: / yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The syllable oṃ is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de yang aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a ste phat shes rab po //
analyzed: de yang aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a ste phat shes rab po //
translated: That is also oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā. Phaṭ is wisdom.

original: sv'a h'a thabs so //
analyzed: sv'a h'a thabs so //
translated: Svāhā is method.

original: di gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: di gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: Those two are indivisible.

original: yi ge aom gyis rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: yi ge aom gyis rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The syllable oṃ is the three vajras.

original: yi ge a'a: sa kyang de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: yi ge a'a: sa kyang de bzhin du'o //
translated: The syllable āḥ is also that.

original: yi ge h'um gyis kyang de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag @21a * //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gyis kyang de kho na nyid gsum gyi bdag @21a * //
translated: The syllable hūṃ is also the nature of the three realities.

original: nyid yin pa'i phyir gsum kas kyang dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid yin pa'i phyir gsum kas kyang dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all three are the complete maṇḍala of the nature of the nine.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi sngags bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi sngags bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the mantra that is the essence of the gathering of all tathāgatas,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spro ba'i tshul gyi sa bon gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spro ba'i tshul gyi sa bon gsungs pa /
translated: now the seed syllables of the mode of emanation of all tathāgatas are taught.

original: bum a'am dzr'im kham h'um /
analyzed: bum a'am dzr'im kham h'um /
translated: The vase, āṃ, jriṃ, khaṃ, hūṃ.

original: bum ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: bum ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The syllable “bu” is Vairocana.

original: aam ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: aam ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The syllable “aṃ” is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: dzr'im ni 'od dpag med pa'o //
analyzed: dzr'im ni 'od dpag med pa'o //
translated: The syllable “jriṃ” is Amitābha.

original: kham ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: kham ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The syllable “khaṃ” is Amoghasiddhi.

original: h'um ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: h'um ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The syllable “hūṃ” is Akṣobhya.

original: 'di gnyis spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid 'bras bu rdo rje 'chang dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya'o //
translated: These two, having the nature of emanation and reabsorption, are the result, Vajradhara, Hevajra.

original: phyag bcu drug pa de'i sngags tha mi dang par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag bcu drug pa de'i sngags tha mi dang par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The mantra of that sixteen-armed one is to be explained in brief:

original: aom de wa pi tsu badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: aom de wa pi tsu badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa smos te /
translated: Oṃ deva picu vajra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom zhes pa ni sku'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni sku'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The syllable “oṃ” is the vajra of body.

original: de yang lha yin te /
analyzed: de yang lha yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is a god,

original: lha spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas lha'o //
analyzed: lha spro ba'i tshul gyis gnas lha'o //
translated: a god of the place in the manner of emanating gods.

original: de yang pi tsu gso ba ste bsdu ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de yang pi tsu gso ba ste bsdu ba'i tshul lo //
translated: Moreover, “picu” is nourishing, in the manner of reabsorption.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba dbyer mi phyed pa ni badzra'o //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba dbyer mi phyed pa ni badzra'o //
translated: The inseparability of emanation and reabsorption is “vajra.”

original: de yang yi ge h'um gsum gyi bdag nyid yi ge h'um re re yang rdo rje gsum gyis so //
analyzed: de yang yi ge h'um gsum gyi bdag nyid yi ge h'um re re yang rdo rje gsum gyis so //
translated: Moreover, it has the nature of three syllables “hūṃ,” and each syllable “hūṃ” is of the three vajras.

original: phat sv'a h'a dag ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phat sv'a h'a dag ni thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Phaṭ svāhā is the vajra of delight of the maṇḍala of nine because of being the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de nyid dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de nyid dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i snying po'o //
translated: That is the essence of the vajra of delight.

original: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ye shes yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ye shes yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the gnosis called the vajra of delight, which is the nonduality of method and wisdom, is that.

original: de nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the conventional and the ultimate are nondual.

original: 'di ni a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sngags thams cad kyi rkang pa dang por yi ge aom dang / mthar ni sv'a h'a dang h'um phat kyi yi ges spel bar bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni a'a li k'a li'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sngags thams cad kyi rkang pa dang por yi ge aom dang / mthar ni sv'a h'a dang h'um phat kyi yi ges spel bar bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Since this is the nature of ālikāli, at the beginning of all mantras, the syllable oṃ, and at the end, the syllables svāhā, hūṃ, and phaṭ are added.

original: n'a da thams cad yi ge h'um phat kyi nang du sngags kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: n'a da thams cad yi ge h'um phat kyi nang du sngags kyi tshig yin no //
translated: All nāḍīs are mantras, and the words are within the syllables hūṃ and phaṭ.

original: yang na sngags thams cad kyi rkang pa zhes ni /
analyzed: yang na sngags thams cad kyi rkang pa zhes ni /
translated: Or, at the beginning of all mantras means that.

original: ma lus pa'i n'a da'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i n'a da'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the Vajra Holder because he is the nature of the gnosis of the complete nada.

original: de nyid dang por aom gyi yi ge dang mthar sv'a h'a'o //🔽yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa ste de nyid dang po ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang por aom gyi yi ge dang mthar sv'a h'a'o // yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa ste de nyid dang po ste /
translated: He himself is at the beginning with the syllable Om and at the end with Svaha.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The syllable Om is the indivisibility of the three vajras, and he is at the beginning because he is their nature.

original: mthar ni sv'a h'a ni /
analyzed: mthar ni sv'a h'a ni /
translated: At the end is Svaha.

original: sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Sva is the three vajras.

original: h'a ni thab dang shes rab po //
analyzed: h'a ni thab dang shes rab po //
translated: Ha is the fire and wisdom.

original: 'di mtha' ma yin pas mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di mtha' ma yin pas mtha'o //
translated: This is the end, so it is the end.

original: de yang aa ni gnyis su med pa'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: de yang aa ni gnyis su med pa'i he ru ka'o //
translated: Moreover, A is nondual Heruka.

original: de nyid kyi phyir h'um phat kyi yi ge srel lo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir h'um phat kyi yi ge srel lo zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the syllables Hum and Phat are praised.

original: h'um rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: h'um rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Hum is the Vajra Holder.

original: @21b phat shes rab bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: @21b phat shes rab bdag med ma'o //
translated: Phat is the wisdom Nairatmya.

original: de dag la yi ge spel ba ni mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la yi ge spel ba ni mtshan pa'o //
translated: The extension of those syllables is the sign.

original: de nyid chad par 'gyur pa yang /
analyzed: de nyid chad par 'gyur pa yang /
translated: That itself is the cutting off.

original: yi ge las byung gong bu la /🔽h'um phat yi ge 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: yi ge las byung gong bu la / h'um phat yi ge 'dod mi bya //
translated: In the aggregate that arises from the syllables,

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: one should not desire the syllables Hum and Phat.

original: de nyid a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis n'a da rnams dang rdo rje 'chang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: de nyid a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin gyis n'a da rnams dang rdo rje 'chang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: That is the nature of Alikali, and the nada-s are not different from Vajradhara.

original: aom aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha sv'a h'a /
translated: Om akachataphaya sha svaha.

original: grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of the city-disturbance.

original: grong khyer ni lus sa //
analyzed: grong khyer ni lus sa //
translated: The city is the body.

original: de dkrugs pa ni rang bzhin med par byad pas na grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: de dkrugs pa ni rang bzhin med par byad pas na grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
translated: The disturbance of that is the absence of intrinsic nature, and so it is the mantra of the city-disturbance.

original: de yang yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang yi ge aom ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, the syllable om is the three vajra-s.

original: de yang aa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang aa zhes pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the a is

original: bdag med la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dbyangs bco lnga'o //
analyzed: bdag med la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi dbyangs bco lnga'o //
translated: the fifteen vowels, which are the nature of the fifteen yogini-s such as Nairatmya.

original: ka tsa ta ta pa rnams ni /
analyzed: ka tsa ta ta pa rnams ni /
translated: The ka, ca, ta, ta, and pa

original: re re yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: re re yang ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa lnga ste /
translated: are each the five tathagata-s, which are the nature of the five wisdom-s.

original: yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: yi ge nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: These are the twenty-five syllables.

original: ya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ya zhes pa ni /
translated: The ya is

original: ya ra la wa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi lha mo bzhi'o //
analyzed: ya ra la wa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi lha mo bzhi'o //
translated: the four yogini-s, which are the nature of the four great elements.

original: sha zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sha zhes pa ni /
translated: The sha is

original: sha sha sa ste sku gsung thugs rnams te /
analyzed: sha sha sa ste sku gsung thugs rnams te /
translated: the body, speech, and mind.

original: sku gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The three syllables are the nature of the three bodies.

original: sv'a zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sv'a zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Sva is the three vajras.

original: h'a zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje 'chang yin te /
analyzed: h'a zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje 'chang yin te /
translated: Ha is Vajradhara, the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for agitating the city.

original: de la aa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la aa zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, a is

original: rnal 'byor ma'i bsdus pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i bsdus pa'i sa bon no //
translated: the seed syllable of the yoginīs.

original: 'di nyid gsal por gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal por gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated clearly:

original: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam zhes pa smos te //
analyzed: aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam zhes pa smos te //
translated: a ā i ī u ū ri rī li lī ai aie o au aṃ.

original: ai ai au re li zhes pa lnga po 'di ni /
analyzed: ai ai au re li zhes pa lnga po 'di ni /
translated: The five, i ī u ri li,

original: gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: are nondual.

original: a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i zhes pa lnga ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: a'a a'i a'u r'i l'i zhes pa lnga ni dbyer mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The five, ā ā ū rī lī, are inseparable.

original: ae ao aam gsum ni sa'i bdag nyid kyi dbyangs yig rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: ae ao aam gsum ni sa'i bdag nyid kyi dbyangs yig rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three, ai au aṃ, are the three vajras, the vowels that are the nature of earth.

original: aee aoo ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i bzhi pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: aee aoo ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i bzhi pa'o // rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi sa bon no zhes pa ni /
translated: Ai au is the fourth, the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The seed syllables of the yoginīs

original: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas /
translated: are the seed syllables of the yoginīs because yoga exists here.

original: des sa bon ni skyad par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: des sa bon ni skyad par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: That is the seed of the cause of generation.

original: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma nyid mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma nyid mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: The signless is just the sign of the nature of non-arising.

original: ka tsa ta la sogs pa k'a li'i gzugs kyis thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyag gnyis pa'i sa bon dang sngags so //
analyzed: ka tsa ta la sogs pa k'a li'i gzugs kyis thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phyag gnyis pa'i sa bon dang sngags so //
translated: The seed and mantra of the two-armed one are ka, ca, ṭa, and so on, in the form of kālī, because of being the nature of method.

original: aom tree lo ky'a kssha pa h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tree lo ky'a kssha pa h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ trailokyākṣapaha hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa la gnyis smos pas thabs dang shes rab dag de'i bdag nyid kyis longs spyod pas na phyag gnyis pa'o //🔽de'i aom ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid de gsum gyi sgras sku @22a * //
analyzed: zhes pa la gnyis smos pas thabs dang shes rab dag de'i bdag nyid kyis longs spyod pas na phyag gnyis pa'o // de'i aom ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa nyid de gsum gyi sgras sku @22a * //
translated: Since the two are mentioned, the two-armed one is the enjoyment of method and wisdom by their nature.

original: gsung thugs so //
analyzed: gsung thugs so //
translated: The oṃ of that is the indivisibility of the three vajras. The three are the body, speech, and mind.

original: lo ka'i sgras phung po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: lo ka'i sgras phung po lnga rnams te /
translated: The word loka is the five aggregates.

original: gsum yang yin la 'jig rten yang yin pas 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum yang yin la 'jig rten yang yin pas 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: Since they are three and also worlds, they are the three worlds.

original: lnga po gsum la sum 'gyur gyis dgu'i bdag nyid dang bco lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
analyzed: lnga po gsum la sum 'gyur gyis dgu'i bdag nyid dang bco lnga'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis so //
translated: The two maṇḍalas are the nature of nine by tripling the three and the nature of fifteen.

original: de'i dngos po'i tree lo ky'a ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i tree lo ky'a ni /
translated: The substance of that is Trailokya.

original: da sang bar byed pas te /
analyzed: da sang bar byed pas te /
translated: It is made today,

original: tree lo ky'a kashe pa'o //
analyzed: tree lo ky'a kashe pa'o //
translated: and so it is Trailokyākṣepa.

original: de yang h'um h'um h'um zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yang h'um h'um h'um zhes pa ni /
translated: Moreover, “hum hum hum”

original: sum 'gyur gyis na dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sum 'gyur gyis na dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: is the maṇḍala of the nature of nine by the tripling.

original: phat sv'a h'a ni phat shes rab po //
analyzed: phat sv'a h'a ni phat shes rab po //
translated: “ Phaṭ svāhā” is the wisdom phaṭ.

original: sv'a h'a thabs so //
analyzed: sv'a h'a thabs so //
translated: Svāhā is the method.

original: de ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pas bo la ka ko la sbyar ba las dga' bzhi'i rnam par dag pa'i phyag bzhi pa'i bcom ldan 'das de'i /
analyzed: de ni thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pas bo la ka ko la sbyar ba las dga' bzhi'i rnam par dag pa'i phyag bzhi pa'i bcom ldan 'das de'i /
translated: Since that is the indivisibility of method and wisdom, from the union of bola and kakkola, the four mudrās of the purity of the four joys are the Bhagavān.

original: aom dzva la dzva la bhyo h'um h'um phat ces smos so //
analyzed: aom dzva la dzva la bhyo h'um h'um phat ces smos so //
translated: “ Oṃ jvala jvala bhyo hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ” is stated.

original: aom zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: “ Oṃ” is Vajradhara, the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bzhi'o //
analyzed: de yang dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, there are four by the stages of joy and so on.

original: gsal ba yin pas dzva la dzva la'o //
analyzed: gsal ba yin pas dzva la dzva la'o //
translated: Since it is clear, it is “jvala jvala.”

original: de yang bhyo mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bhyo mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, “bhyo” is Akṣobhya.

original: h'um h'um h'um ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: “ Hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ” is suchness.

original: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phat sv'a h'a zhes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: “ Phaṭ svāhā” is also that.

original: da ni phyag gnyis pa dang phyag bzhi pa dag drug pa'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni phyag gnyis pa dang phyag bzhi pa dag drug pa'i rang bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the two-armed and four-armed [forms] are said to be of the nature of the six-armed [form].🔽Om kīṭikīṭi vajra hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: aom ki ti ki ti badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ste thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: aom ki ti ki ti badzra h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ste thams cad snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All is as before.

original: ki ti ki ti ni rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: ki ti ki ti ni rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhad pa'o //
translated: Kīṭikīṭi is the laughter of the yoginīs.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The yoginī is Vajradhara, whose nature is clear light.

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dgyes pa'i rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dgyes pa'i rdo rje yin no //
translated: He is Hevajra, whose nature is the emanation and reabsorption [of the universe].

original: phyag gnyis pa dang phyag bzhi pa dang phyag drug pa gsum po 'di yang thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa dang dga' ba bzhi ste drug gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa dang phyag bzhi pa dang phyag drug pa gsum po 'di yang thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa dang dga' ba bzhi ste drug gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The three [forms of Hevajra]—the two-armed, the four-armed, and the six-armed—are also of the nature of the nonduality of method and wisdom and the four joys.

original: sku gsung thugs ni rnal 'byor ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi he ru ka gsum ste /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rnal 'byor ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi he ru ka gsum ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are the three herukas, whose nature is the fifteen yoginīs.

original: ye shes bco lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes bco lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: They are the nature of the fifteen pristine awarenesses.

original: de byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra that empowers them is:

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum ste /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa'i yi ge gsum ste /
translated: The three syllables are OṂ, AḤ, and HŪṂ.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags so //
translated: This is the consecration mantra.

original: ting nge 'dzin lhag par phan tshun du dmigs pa'i gnas so //🔽gnas zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin lhag par phan tshun du dmigs pa'i gnas so // gnas zhes pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: The samādhi is the locus of mutual observation.

original: de yang he ru ka'i gzugs kyi sngags so //
analyzed: de yang he ru ka'i gzugs kyi sngags so //
translated: The locus is the consecration, and that is the mantra of the form of Heruka.

original: 'di lta bu'i de kho na nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i sgra ni bzhi pa 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i de kho na nyid kyi don skul bar byed pa'i sgra ni bzhi pa 'bras bu'i rdo rje 'chang stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The sound that impels the meaning of suchness is the fourth, the result, Vajradhara, the purity of the sixteen emptinesses.🔽That is the consecration of the four Herukas, and having understood the hidden, one should abide in its nature.

original: de  ni @22b he ru ka bzhi byin gyis brlabs pa dang // sbas pa rtogs par byas nas de'i rang bzhin gyis gnas par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sa sbyang ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de  ni @22b he ru ka bzhi byin gyis brlabs pa dang // sbas pa rtogs par byas nas de'i rang bzhin gyis gnas par bya ba yin pa'i phyir sa sbyang ba'i sngags ni /
translated: Therefore, the mantra for purifying the ground is:

original: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
analyzed: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
translated: OṂ RAṂ RAṂ HŪṂ HŪṂ HŪṂ PHAṬ SVĀHĀ.

original: sa'i sgras ni chos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa'i sgras ni chos 'byung ngo //
translated: The word “ground” means the source of phenomena.

original: de sbyang ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de sbyang ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Purifying it is the purity of all phenomena.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra of that.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don /
translated: The meaning of reality.

original: skul bar byed pas sgra'o //
analyzed: skul bar byed pas sgra'o //
translated: Sound is that which impels.

original: de yang yi ge aom ni sku rdo rje ste thabs so //
analyzed: de yang yi ge aom ni sku rdo rje ste thabs so //
translated: Moreover, the syllable Oṃ is the vajra of body, which is the means.

original: ra ni shes rab po //
analyzed: ra ni shes rab po //
translated: The syllable Ra is wisdom.

original: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa ni yi ge ksha ste /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa ni yi ge ksha ste /
translated: The means and wisdom that are inseparable are the syllable KṢa.

original: de yang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is destruction.

original: ksha zhes pa ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: ksha zhes pa ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: KṢa is imperishable.

original: 'ga' zhig 'jig pas thim par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'jig pas thim par 'gyur //
translated: Some are destroyed and dissolve.

original: gang zhig dngos med zad pa'ang med //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med zad pa'ang med //
translated: That which is not an entity is also not exhausted.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
translated: HŪṃ Phaṭ Svāhā

original: thams cad sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of this has been explained previously.

original: de nyid rengs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rengs par byed pa ste /
translated: That is the paralysis.

original: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa ni rengs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa ni rengs par byed pa ste /
translated: Oṃ HŪṃ Svāhā is the paralysis.

original: g-yo bcas kyi rtsol bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo bcas kyi rtsol bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the effort of the moving.

original: yang na aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aom ni rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, Oṃ is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: de bzhin du h'um yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du h'um yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is HŪṃ.

original: de ltar sv'a yang ste /
analyzed: de ltar sv'a yang ste /
translated: In the same way, it is Svā.

original: gsum ni de kho na nyid gsum tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: gsum ni de kho na nyid gsum tha mi dad pas so //
translated: The three are the indivisibility of the three realities.

original: h'a zhes pa ni thabs shes rab dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: h'a zhes pa ni thabs shes rab dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Ha is because of the inseparability of means and insight.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni g-yo ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Vajrasattva is the very immobility.

original: sems ni brtan par gyur na spro //
analyzed: sems ni brtan par gyur na spro //
translated: When the mind becomes firm, it is expanded.

original: brtan par ma gyur de mi spro //
analyzed: brtan par ma gyur de mi spro //
translated: When it does not become firm, it is not expanded.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: aom aam sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aam sv'a h'a /
translated: Om am svāhā.

original: dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: This is the mantra of subjugation.

original: aom ni thabs so //
analyzed: aom ni thabs so //
translated: Om is the means.

original: aam ni shes rab po //
analyzed: aam ni shes rab po //
translated: Am is the insight.

original: sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sv'a ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Svā is the three vajras.

original: h'a ni thams cad dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: h'a ni thams cad dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Ha is the inseparability of all.

original: dbang du bya ba'i sngags ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i sngags ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis so //
translated: The mantra of subjugation is by means of the intuition of equality.

original: aom kham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom kham sv'a h'a /
translated: Om kham svāhā.

original: skrod pa'i sngags so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skrod pa'i sngags so zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the mantra of expulsion.

original: sngags 'dis gnas las g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis gnas las g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: This mantra causes movement from the place.

original: yang na skrod pa ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: yang na skrod pa ni spro ba'o //
translated: Or, expulsion is expansion.🔽Om is the three vajras, which are inseparable.

original: aom rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa gang de kham ye shes lnga rnams so //🔽sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
analyzed: aom rdo rje gsum tha mi dad pa gang de kham ye shes lnga rnams so //🔽sv'a h'a zhes pa ni /
translated: Kham is the five intuitions.🔽Svāhā is the three seed syllables.

original: rdo rje gsum thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis spro bar byed pas na rdo rje rta mchog gis so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyis spro bar byed pas na rdo rje rta mchog gis so //
translated: Since one emanates by means of the three vajras, which are the nature of method and wisdom, it is with the supreme horse of the vajra.🔽 Om jriṃ svāhā is

original: aom dzrim sv' h'a zhes bya ba ni /🔽sdang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: aom dzrim sv' h'a zhes bya ba ni / sdang bar byed pa ste /
translated: the mantra for the enmity

original: dbye bar byed pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: dbye bar byed pa'i sngags so //
translated: that is, the mantra for the separation.

original: yang na sdang ba ni gnyis smos pas thabs dang shes rab de dag 'dod pas na sdang ba ste zung 'jug go //🔽de yang aom dzr'am sv'a h'a zhes pa'i de kho na nyid gsum dbyer @23a * //
analyzed: yang na sdang ba ni gnyis smos pas thabs dang shes rab de dag 'dod pas na sdang ba ste zung 'jug go // de yang aom dzr'am sv'a h'a zhes pa'i de kho na nyid gsum dbyer @23a * //
translated: Alternatively, enmity is the method and wisdom that are mentioned twice, and since one desires them, it is enmity, that is, union.

original: med pas na snang ba mtha' yas kyis so //
analyzed: med pas na snang ba mtha' yas kyis so //
translated: Moreover, since the three realities of om jriṃ svāhā are inseparable, it is with Amitābha.

original: aom bum sv'a h'a zhes pa ni mngon spyod kyi'o //
analyzed: aom bum sv'a h'a zhes pa ni mngon spyod kyi'o //
translated: Om buṃ svāhā is for the killing

original: mngon spyod kyi sgras rims la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi sgras rims la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: that is, for the plague, and so on.

original: yang na mngon spyod ces pa ni /
analyzed: yang na mngon spyod ces pa ni /
translated: Alternatively, killing

original: de nyid zhe sdang rdo rje ste thams cad la khyab pa nyid kyis na mngon spyod de ma ning ngo //
analyzed: de nyid zhe sdang rdo rje ste thams cad la khyab pa nyid kyis na mngon spyod de ma ning ngo //
translated: is the reality of the anger vajra, and since it pervades everything, it is killing, that is, the neuter.

original: de yang bum smos pas /
analyzed: de yang bum smos pas /
translated: Moreover, since buṃ is mentioned,

original: byang chub kyi sems khu bzhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems khu bzhes bya ste /
translated: it is the bodhicitta, that is, the seminal fluid.🔽 🔽Svāhā is the supreme offering, that is, the supreme offering of the seminal fluid.

original: de nyid rdo rje gsum nyid kyis khyab pa yin pas na rnam par snang mdzad kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gsum nyid kyis khyab pa yin pas na rnam par snang mdzad kyis so //
translated: Since that is pervaded by the three vajras, it is Vairocana.

original: aom sv'a h'a ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom sv'a h'a ni bshad zin pa'i don to //
translated: Om svāhā has the meaning already explained.

original: aom h'um sv'a h'a /🔽'gugs par byed pa'o zhes pa ni //
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a h'a / 'gugs par byed pa'o zhes pa ni //
translated: Om hūṃ svāhā.🔽The one who attracts is

original: rlung la sogs pa 'gugs par byed pa yin no //🔽yang na bshad zin pa'i don gyis thams cad ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gugs pa ni bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa 'gugs par byed pa yin no // yang na bshad zin pa'i don gyis thams cad ni tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'gugs pa ni bsdus pa ste /
translated: the one who attracts wind, etc.

original: mi bskyod pas so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pas so //
translated: Or else, since all is non-different by the meaning already explained, attraction is the gathering, by Akṣobhya.

original: aom ghu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ghu sv'a h'a /
translated: Om ghu svāhā.

original: gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who kills is

original: yang na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams gsod cing 'phye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams gsod cing 'phye ba'o //
translated: the one who kills and destroys objects, faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: de yang ghu ni dang po'i bzhi pa la mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa tsheg drag gi mtha' can ste /
analyzed: de yang ghu ni dang po'i bzhi pa la mkha' 'gro mas brgyan pa tsheg drag gi mtha' can ste /
translated: Moreover, ghu is the fourth of the first [g], adorned with dakini, and has the end of visarga.

original: 'di rnams kun ni rnam par spangs //
analyzed: 'di rnams kun ni rnam par spangs //
translated: All of these are abandoned

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: by the words.

original: aom sv'a h'a zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom sv'a h'a zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Om svāhā is easy to understand.

original: gsod pa bsdu bar bstan nas /
analyzed: gsod pa bsdu bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the gathering of killing,

original: 'gro ba drug gi mnyam pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi mnyam pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The equality of the six migrations is taught.

original: aom ku ru ku lle hr'i: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ku ru ku lle hr'i: sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kuru ku llé hriḥ svāhā.

original: ku ru ku lle'i sngags so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ku ru ku lle'i sngags so zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the mantra of Kurukullā.

original: sems sna tshogs dbang du bya ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: sems sna tshogs dbang du bya ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for controlling the various minds.

original: yang na ku ru ku lle hr'i: las /
analyzed: yang na ku ru ku lle hr'i: las /
translated: Or else, from the syllables of kuru ku llé hriḥ,

original: sku ru ku zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sku ru ku zhes pa ni /
translated: the body is kuru.

original: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i dga' ba gsum mo //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab tha mi dad pa'i dga' ba gsum mo //
translated: The three joys of the indivisible method and wisdom.

original: de yang lle ni gsum kha sbyor ro //
analyzed: de yang lle ni gsum kha sbyor ro //
translated: Moreover, llé is the union of the three.

original: de yang hr'i: tsheg drag gi mtha' can bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang hr'i: tsheg drag gi mtha' can bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, hriḥ is the fourth with an exclamation point.

original: aom sv'a h'a ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom sv'a h'a ni go sla'o //
translated: Oṃ svāhā is easy to understand.

original: 'gro ba drug mnyam pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug mnyam pas so //
translated: It is equal to the six migrations.

original: ku ru ku lle'i sngags bstan zin nas de'i mthu bstan pa da ni char dbab pa'i chog gsungs pa /
analyzed: ku ru ku lle'i sngags bstan zin nas de'i mthu bstan pa da ni char dbab pa'i chog gsungs pa /
translated: Having explained the mantra of Kurukullā, now the rite of causing rain is explained.

original: aa phu'i yi ges mtha' yas kyi gzugs byas la /
analyzed: aa phu'i yi ges mtha' yas kyi gzugs byas la /
translated: Make a form of Ananta with the letter a.

original: bdud rtsi lngas ni blugs me tog nag pos ni mchod /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lngas ni blugs me tog nag pos ni mchod /
translated: Fill it with the five elixirs and make offerings with black flowers.

original: klu 'dul bar byed pa'i khu bas ni blugs /
analyzed: klu 'dul bar byed pa'i khu bas ni blugs /
translated: Fill it with the juice that subdues the nāgas.

original: klang po che'i chang gis ni mgo bo byug kham phor kha sbyar du ni gzhag / ba nag mo'i 'o mas ni dgang /
analyzed: klang po che'i chang gis ni mgo bo byug kham phor kha sbyar du ni gzhag / ba nag mo'i 'o mas ni dgang /
translated: The head is anointed with elephant urine, and it is placed in a joined pair of bowls.🔽It is filled with the milk of a black cow,

original: gzhon nu ma nag mos bkal ba'i skud pas ni dkri /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma nag mos bkal ba'i skud pas ni dkri /
translated: and it is wrapped in a thread spun by a dark-complexioned young woman.

original: rlung gi phyogs su rdzing bu byas te /
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su rdzing bu byas te /
translated: A pond is made in a windy place,

original: mtha' yas der gzhag @23b go //
analyzed: mtha' yas der gzhag @23b go //
translated: and Ananta is placed there.

original: de'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya te /
analyzed: de'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya te /
translated: A maṇḍala is erected next to it.

original: dur khrod kyi sol bas ni rdul tshon nag po /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol bas ni rdul tshon nag po /
translated: Black powder is used for the black dust,

original: skyes pa'i rus pa'i phye mas ni rdul tshon dkar po /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rus pa'i phye mas ni rdul tshon dkar po /
translated: white powder from a man’s bones is used for the white dust,

original: ldong ros kyis ni rdul tshon ser po /
analyzed: ldong ros kyis ni rdul tshon ser po /
translated: realgar is used for the yellow dust,

original: dur khrod kyi so phag gis ni rdul tshon dmar po /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi so phag gis ni rdul tshon dmar po /
translated: a corpse’s brick is used for the red dust,

original: rkun ma'i lo ma dang / skyes pa'i rus pa'i phye ma dag gis ni rdul tshon ljang gu ste /
analyzed: rkun ma'i lo ma dang / skyes pa'i rus pa'i phye ma dag gis ni rdul tshon ljang gu ste /
translated: and the leaves of a śirīṣa tree and white powder from a man’s bones are used for the green dust.

original: rdul tshon 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs so //
analyzed: rdul tshon 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs so //
translated: The maṇḍala is erected with these powders.

original: dur khro ba kyi srad bus thig gdab cing dkyil 'khor khru gsum pa byas te /
analyzed: dur khro ba kyi srad bus thig gdab cing dkyil 'khor khru gsum pa byas te /
translated: The maṇḍala is three cubits in size, and the lines are drawn with a string from a charnel ground.

original: de'i dbus su mtha' yas mnan pa'i kye'i rdo rje bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su mtha' yas mnan pa'i kye'i rdo rje bri bar bya ste /
translated: In the middle of that, one should draw Akṣobhya-Hevajra,

original: zhal brgyad pa /
analyzed: zhal brgyad pa /
translated: with eight faces,

original: zhabs bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhabs bzhi pa /
translated: four feet,

original: phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with sixteen arms,

original: spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis che ba /
analyzed: spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis che ba /
translated: with twenty-four eyes,

original: 'jigs pa'ang 'jigs par mdzad pa bri'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'ang 'jigs par mdzad pa bri'o //
translated: frightening even the fearful.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis dben pa'i gnas su sngags bzlas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis dben pa'i gnas su sngags bzlas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the master, with an inner malicious mind, should recite the mantra in a secluded place.

original: klu'i mtshe'u chu kha dog nag po'i 'jim pa nag po la aa phu zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis lan brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du mngon par bsngags te /
analyzed: klu'i mtshe'u chu kha dog nag po'i 'jim pa nag po la aa phu zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis lan brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du mngon par bsngags te /
translated: With black clay from the mouth of a black lake of nāgas, he should enchant it with the mantra a phu one hundred and eight times.

original: blangs nas slar mtha' yas zhes bya ba klu de'i gzugs brnyan byed cing mngon par bsngags te de'i gzugs brnyan bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas slar mtha' yas zhes bya ba klu de'i gzugs brnyan byed cing mngon par bsngags te de'i gzugs brnyan bya'o //
translated: Taking it, he should make an image of that nāga named Ananta, and enchant it.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni 'o ma la sogs pas khrus chab gsol lo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni 'o ma la sogs pas khrus chab gsol lo //
translated: The five nectars are milk, etc. He should offer a bath.

original: me tog nag pos zhes pa ni zar ma'i me tog gis so //
analyzed: me tog nag pos zhes pa ni zar ma'i me tog gis so //
translated: With black flowers means with mustard flowers.

original: de med na me tog sngon po gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de med na me tog sngon po gzhan gyis kyang ngo //
translated: If it is not there, then by another blue flower.

original: mchod pa ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship is the worship.

original: klu 'dul bar byed pa'i khu bas ni byug / glang po che'i chang gis ni mgo bo byug / kham phor kha sbyar du ni gzhug pa ni /
analyzed: klu 'dul bar byed pa'i khu bas ni byug / glang po che'i chang gis ni mgo bo byug / kham phor kha sbyar du ni gzhug pa ni /
translated: With the juice of the nāga-taming, one should anoint; with the wine of the elephant, one should anoint the head; and one should place it in a pair of joined bowls.

original: 'jim pa de nyid las byas pa'i kham phor so ma btang ba gnyis so /
analyzed: 'jim pa de nyid las byas pa'i kham phor so ma btang ba gnyis so /
translated: The bowls are made of the same clay, and are unfired.

original: der ba nag mo'i 'o mas ni dgang /
analyzed: der ba nag mo'i 'o mas ni dgang /
translated: In that, one should pour the milk of a black cow.

original: gzhon nu ma nag mos bkal ba'i skud pas dkri /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma nag mos bkal ba'i skud pas dkri /
translated: One should wrap it with thread spun by a dark-complexioned maiden.

original: rlung gi phyogs su rdzing bu byas te /
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su rdzing bu byas te /
translated: In a place with a breeze, one should make a pond.

original: mtha' yas der bzhag go //
analyzed: mtha' yas der bzhag go //
translated: One should place Ananta there.

original: de'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya ste ;
analyzed: de'i 'gram du dkyil 'khor bzhengs par bya ste ;
translated: Beside it, one should erect the maṇḍala.

original: / bdud rtsi lngas ni blugs pa la sogs pa bya ba bcu rnams la re re zhing yang yi ge aa phu'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du yongs su bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: / bdud rtsi lngas ni blugs pa la sogs pa bya ba bcu rnams la re re zhing yang yi ge aa phu'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyi bar du yongs su bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should perform the ten actions, such as pouring with the five nectars, and for each one, one should recite the mantra of the syllable aṃ up to one hundred and eight times.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa yang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa yang /
translated: As for erecting the maṇḍala,

original: dur khrod kyi sol bas rdul tshon nag po ni mi bskyod pa'i rnam par dag pas bya'o //🔽skyes @24a * //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi sol bas rdul tshon nag po ni mi bskyod pa'i rnam par dag pas bya'o // skyes @24a * //
translated: The black colored sand is the purification of Akṣobhya.

original: pa'i rus pas ni rdul tshon dkar po zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: pa'i rus pas ni rdul tshon dkar po zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The white colored sand is the purification of Vairocana.

original: ldong ros kyis rdul tshon ser po ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnam par dag pas bya'o //
analyzed: ldong ros kyis rdul tshon ser po ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rnam par dag pas bya'o //
translated: The yellow colored sand is the purification of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: dur khrod kyi so phag gis rdul tshon dmar po ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnam par dag pas so //🔽rkun ma'i lo ma dang skyes pa'i rus pa dag gis rdul tshon ljang gu ste ni don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi so phag gis rdul tshon dmar po ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rnam par dag pas so // rkun ma'i lo ma dang skyes pa'i rus pa dag gis rdul tshon ljang gu ste ni don yod grub pa'i rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The red colored sand is the purification of Amitābha.🔽The green colored sand is the purification of Amoghasiddhi.

original: mi'i rus pa dang dur khrod kyi sol bas ni rdul tshon sngon po ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: mi'i rus pa dang dur khrod kyi sol bas ni rdul tshon sngon po ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The blue colored sand is the purification of Vajrasattva.

original: rdul tshon 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs so //
analyzed: rdul tshon 'di rnams kyis dkyil 'khor bzhengs so //
translated: The maṇḍala is constructed with these colored sands.

original: dur khrod kyi srad bus thig gdab cing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi srad bus thig gdab cing zhes pa ni /
translated: The chalk line is drawn with the thread from a charnel ground.

original: bcu bzhi'am brgyad la 'du byed pa'i sa gzhir thig skud byin gyis brlabs te bzhag la /
analyzed: bcu bzhi'am brgyad la 'du byed pa'i sa gzhir thig skud byin gyis brlabs te bzhag la /
translated: On the fourteenth or the eighth, one should consecrate the thread for the maṇḍala base and lay it out.

original: 'dus bya ba zin nas thig skud des thig btab pa'i dkyil 'khor khru gsum pa mi bskyod pa'i rnam par dag pa bzhengs nas /
analyzed: 'dus bya ba zin nas thig skud des thig btab pa'i dkyil 'khor khru gsum pa mi bskyod pa'i rnam par dag pa bzhengs nas /
translated: After the preparatory rites are complete, one should draw the maṇḍala with the thread, three cubits in size, in the form of Akṣobhya.

original: de'i dbus su mtha' yas mnan pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su mtha' yas mnan pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje bri bar bya ste /
translated: In the center of that, one should draw Hevajra, trampling on Ananta,

original: zhal brgyad pa /
analyzed: zhal brgyad pa /
translated: with eight faces,

original: zhabs bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhabs bzhi pa /
translated: four feet,

original: phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyag bcu drug gis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with sixteen hands,

original: spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis che ba /
analyzed: spyan nyi shu rtsa bzhis che ba /
translated: with twenty-four eyes,🔽and with the sixteen hands holding the hand implements.

original: phyag bcu drug mtshan ma can de dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag bcu drug mtshan ma can de dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw him in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor du ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad 'dab ma rnams la phyi nas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni rnal 'byor ma brgyad 'dab ma rnams la phyi nas bri bar bya'o //
translated: The eight yoginīs should be drawn on the petals outside the maṇḍala.

original: 'di dag thams cad byas nas slob dpon gyis sngags bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad byas nas slob dpon gyis sngags bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Having done all of this, the master should recite the mantra.

original: nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis zhes pa la /
analyzed: nang gi ma rungs pa'i sems kyis zhes pa la /
translated: “With an inner, fierce mind” means

original: nang ni brtson 'grus chen por rol ba'o //
analyzed: nang ni brtson 'grus chen por rol ba'o //
translated: “inner” is the play of great diligence.

original: ma rungs pa'i sems ni khros pa'i sems so //
analyzed: ma rungs pa'i sems ni khros pa'i sems so //
translated: The “wicked mind” is the mind of anger.

original: rgyu 'dis sngags bzlas na char 'bab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu 'dis sngags bzlas na char 'bab par 'gyur te /
translated: By this cause, if one recites the mantra, it will rain.

original: dben pa'i gnas su aom gha da gha da /
analyzed: dben pa'i gnas su aom gha da gha da /
translated: In a solitary place, one should recite: “Oṃ ghaṭa ghaṭa🔽ghuda ghuda

original: ghu du ghu du /🔽sa ma sa ma /🔽gha ta gha ta /
analyzed: ghu du ghu du / sa ma sa ma / gha ta gha ta /
translated: sama sama🔽ghaṭa ghaṭa

original: gho ta ya gho ta ya /
analyzed: gho ta ya gho ta ya /
translated: ghotāya ghotāya

original: aa nnta ksho bha ka r'a ya n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye /🔽he he ru ru ka / sapta p'a t'a la ga t'am n'a g'a n'a karsha ya /🔽barsha ya / gardza ya ta rdza ya /🔽phu phu phu phu phu phu phu h'um h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'o //🔽gal te char mi 'bab na de'i sngags 'di bzlog la bzla te /🔽phyin ci log tu bzlas pa yang /🔽sv'a h'a phat phat h'um h'um h'um phu phu phu pu phu phu phu ta rdza ya ga rdza ya /
analyzed: aa nnta ksho bha ka r'a ya n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye / he he ru ru ka / sapta p'a t'a la ga t'am n'a g'a n'a karsha ya / barsha ya / gardza ya ta rdza ya / phu phu phu phu phu phu phu h'um h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'o // gal te char mi 'bab na de'i sngags 'di bzlog la bzla te / phyin ci log tu bzlas pa yang / sv'a h'a phat phat h'um h'um h'um phu phu phu pu phu phu phu ta rdza ya ga rdza ya /
translated: anantakṣobhakārāya nāgādhipate

original: barsha ya / a'a karsha ya n'a g'a n'a sapta p'a t'a la ga t'am /🔽ka ru ru he he /
analyzed: barsha ya / a'a karsha ya n'a g'a n'a sapta p'a t'a la ga t'am /🔽ka ru ru he he /
translated: he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he he

original: n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye @24b aa nnta ksho bha ka r'a ya /
analyzed: n'a g'a dhi pa ta ye @24b aa nnta ksho bha ka r'a ya /
translated: Nāgādhipate ananta-kṣobhaka-kāraya.

original: gho ta ya gho ta ya /
analyzed: gho ta ya gho ta ya /
translated: Ghotaya ghotaya.

original: gha ta gha ta /
analyzed: gha ta gha ta /
translated: Ghata ghata.

original: ma sa ma sa /🔽ghu du ghu du /
analyzed: ma sa ma sa / ghu du ghu du /
translated: Masa masa.🔽Ghudhu gudhu.🔽Ghada ghada.

original: gha da gha da /🔽aom zhes pas char dbab po //
analyzed: gha da gha da / aom zhes pas char dbab po //
translated: Gadgada🔽Om causes rain to fall.

original: de bzhin du yang char mi 'bab na de'i mgo aa rdza ka'i dog pa ltar 'gas so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang char mi 'bab na de'i mgo aa rdza ka'i dog pa ltar 'gas so zhes pa ni /
translated: If it still does not rain, his head will split like a coconut.

original: na se'i snye ma ltar ro //
analyzed: na se'i snye ma ltar ro //
translated: Like a jasmine flower.

original: 'dis ci bstan na nges pa kho na char 'bab par 'gyur ba'i don de char 'bab par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na nges pa kho na char 'bab par 'gyur ba'i don de char 'bab par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: What does this teach? The meaning of the certainty that the rain will fall is that the rain will fall.

original: sprin dral ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sprin dral ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the ritual for dispersing the clouds will be explained.

original: gal te char pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du 'bab na de'i tshe rgya mtsho 'bab zhig tu 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: gal te char pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du 'bab na de'i tshe rgya mtsho 'bab zhig tu 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: If the rain falls continuously, then the ocean will overflow.

original: sprin dral ba'i cho ga dur khrod kyi ras la nye bar 'dug nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sprin dral ba'i cho ga dur khrod kyi ras la nye bar 'dug nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the ritual for dispersing the clouds is as follows: Sitting on a cloth from a charnel ground,

original: de yang bcu bzhi la sogs pa shi ba'i gdong g-yogs pa'i ras blangs pa de la 'dug nas /
analyzed: de yang bcu bzhi la sogs pa shi ba'i gdong g-yogs pa'i ras blangs pa de la 'dug nas /
translated: one should take a cloth that has covered the face of a corpse on the fourteenth day, and so on, and sit on that.

original: sngags bzlas pas dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pas dral bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting the mantra, one should disperse the clouds.

original: aom a'a rya sma sv'a na pri y'a ya h'um h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
